Subject: Re: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy Capitalists

What outdoor party isn't wasteful by your definition? "Green Man" is the 
theme for this year, but other than "leave no trace", BM has never claimed 
to be especially environmentally friendly.

Have you ever been? If not, your "seems to be populated" statement is 
meaningless. Maybe it's a generational thing, I assume you're in your 
early 20s and a lot of people attend who are older?

STDs, ha ha.


On Thu, 30 Aug 2007, pinkko wrote:

> I think it has something to do with a hugely wasteful party being thrown in
> the middle of the desert by people who love to claim that they're
> environmentally friendly. My main gripe is that it seems to be populated
> mostly with a particularly virulent mixture of hippie and yuppie that is far
> more obnoxious than just a plain hippie or a plain yuppie.
>
> Also, the STDs.

>>>> That message was so DEAD ON. The only thing I would
>>>> add is a definition of what the writer does not
>>>> address exactly....
>>>>
>>>> It's a phrase I made up when the dead heads lost their
>>>> parking lot and shows and started ruining the rave
>>>> scene.
>>>>
>>>> HIPPY CAPITALISM
>>>>
>>>> DEFINED AS: Capitalists using hippy idealism for the
>>>> purpose of seperating the idealists from their money
>>>> via a mock-display of those same ideals. The HC
>>>> usually takes on the appearance of the group they are
>>>> extorting. The HC knows the lingo, mind-set, and
>>>> culture of the sub-group they are targetting, and to
>>>> many, appear to be a bullwark of the cause. Many HC's
>>>> have narcicistic tendancies, and fancy the idea that
>>>> they are leader of the group, a revered contributor,
>>>> and in many cases, also think of themselves as
>>>> artistic leaders.
>>>>
>>>> Thats it.
>>>>
>>>> E
>>>>
>>>>>
>>>>> Having read your various comments, a few things
>>>>> should be addressed.
>>>>> First, this operation was extensively planned well
>>>>> in advance, and the
>>>>> number one thing to Black Rock Intelligence was that
>>>>> NO ONE be hurt.
>>>>> If you people actually knew us, you'd know that we
>>>>> have an extensive
>>>>> background in doing things exactly like this. In
>>>>> fact, we were on the
>>>>> ground for some thirty minutes before ascent,
>>>>> scoping the scene and
>>>>> clearing people in order to minimize any possiblity
>>>>> of injury to
>>>>> others. We were aided by several people who were
>>>>> recruited on the
>>>>> playa the night of this burn (BRI has no idea who
>>>>> they are, so don't
>>>>> bother asking).
>>>>>
>>>>> Second, the operation was planned in conjunction
>>>>> with the lunar
>>>>> eclipse because Black Rock Intelligence knew that
>>>>> another event at the
>>>>> trash fence would draw the bulk of lunatics to it,
>>>>> rather than to the
>>>>> Man. In fact, one of our peripheral operatives aided
>>>>> in getting as
>>>>> many people to the fence event as possible to help
>>>>> BRI achieve its
>>>>> goal of zero injuries.
>>>>>
>>>>> Third, word went out across the playa days in
>>>>> advance that Black Rock
>>>>> Intelligence was pulling this op. This word
>>>>> continued to go out right
>>>>> up to the moment that our chief operator began the
>>>>> arduous climb up
>>>>> the guide wire. As you can all see from the results,
>>>>> BRI performed
>>>>> flawlessly in this regard.
>>>>>
>>>>> We could give a fuck less what you all think of us
>>>>> for doing this.
>>>>> Most of you are newbies who have been drawn in by
>>>>> the semi-religious
>>>>> nature of the event, or maybe just the easy drugs
>>>>> and easier sex. You
>>>>> have nothing to offer the event other than your
>>>>> fucking money and
>>>>> obedience. You spend the rest of your lives in
>>>>> mortal fear of
>>>>> everything that insurance companies tell you to
>>>>> fear, and pretend that
>>>>> you're free and clear because you spend four days at
>>>>> a desert
>>>>> bacchanal where spinelessness is not only encouraged
>>>>> but genetically
>>>>> replicated for implementation in successive
>>>>> generations. In short, you
>>>>> are the swine of which Thompson spoke. Get over
>>>>> yourselves.
>>>>>
>>>>> Some of us live quite well without fear. Doing so
>>>>> requires the
>>>>> ultimate in what Burning Man used to represent:
>>>>> personal
>>>>> responsibility and individual liberty. That's all
>>>>> been lost in the
>>>>> last decade of Burning Man's history. Consider this
>>>>> operation a
>>>>> history lesson that was desperately needed.
>>>>>
>>>>> One final note: Black Rock Intelligence has been
>>>>> permanently
>>>>> disbanded. All other operatives have made the
>>>>> ultimate sacrifice by
>>>>> swallowing their L-pills to avoid being captured
>>>>> alive. I am the sole
>>>>> surviving member of BRI and ask that you respect my
>>>>> mourning period
>>>>> for those who gave their lives so that this
>>>>> operation was a complete
>>>>> success.
>>>>>
>>>>> Paul D. Addis
>>>>> Fernley, NV

Subject: RE: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy Capitalists

Why? You know - at 1st I was curious about Burning Man, and to some degree, 
I still want to go - I know enough folks who are in deep with the organizers 
etc., and can even go work my ticket off if I want. It's not the event 
itself that makes me not like the whole thing, or revel in things like the 
early torching of "the man". What irks the shit out of me is how absolutely 
cliquey and exclusive the vast majority of Burners (I have come into contact 
with) are - and how hypocritical most are. If I don't get a discount into an 
event because I'm not wearing furry pants and mesh gloves on my arms, why 
the fuck do I have to pay more to get into someplace? What if my "playa 
wear" is just like my normal clothing? That cliquey, exclusionary bullshit 
is so HIGH SCHOOL. Why on earth would I want to go spend a week of my life 
with a bunch of people who are like that? The thing that attracted me to 
raving was the LACK of exclusivity. It was a "come one come all" vibe. 
Burning Man always comes across as a "Come if you act/look just like us" 
vibe. WEAK.

The fact that almost every Burner I know parties like mad the whole time 
they are out there, and come back with tales of massive drug intake, as well 
as all sorts of scandalous sex stories etc. - and these same people are the 
people who say "it's an ART/COMMUNITY event maaaaaaaan - it's not all about 
drugs", makes me fucking SICK. Y'know - if you just like to party like a 
rock-star for a week solid in the desert - good for you, but don't try and 
act as if you are doing some great communal, community minded, forward 
thinking crap. You are getting fucked up in the desert for a week solid with 
your fellow party-fiend friends. Own it. Embrace it - but don't fucking lie 
to me about it when I call you out on it.

For every one Burner I have met that does any art/project minded stuff that 
is eco-friendly or whatever, I meet a dozen who are just out there getting 
messed up and scoping out the half naked day-glo, pixie-costumed massive. 
Out of a "city" of 40K people, I'd bet there are less than 10% that are 
there for any sort of real community minded reason. Unless your idea of 
community is just to get wacked off yer tits and try and get you some 
playa-ass.

Take the vast majority of Burners out of Burning Man, and I'd be way more 
into going.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy Capitalists

Most of the naysayers are those pretty well familiar with the event
enough to know all the issues and decide for themselves if it's all
worth playing along and wasting resources for one week a year.

The collaborative play narrative co-creation and opportunity to hang
out with old friends for a meaningful amount of time is enough to make
it mostly worth it, despite all the ridiculousness.

That said, the last two years I went to the event looked like this:

2004 - Relationship drama. Art project drama. Spent the weekend
following Bassnectar producer Lorin back and forth from one end of the
playa to another for lack of anything better to do or any decent art
to play with. Could not find any techno. Enjoyed my Indian taco on the
way home.

2004 - More relationship drama. Art project succeeds (being a girl in
distress with propane helps)! Campmates are all too stoned to be
interesting so spend most of the time at Spock Mountain Research Labs
with BORG 2 cohorts making fun of hippies and celebrating our failure.
Best memory: a buddy pees on Paul Fukingmould's tourbus. Brooklyn's
inter-node camp has some minimal techno, but for one night only.
Indian taco express lane to Gerlach...

-Solekandi

> >>>> usually takes on the appearance of the group they are
> >>>> extorting. The HC knows the lingo, mind-set, and
> >>>> culture of the sub-group they are targetting, and to
> >>>> many, appear to be a bullwark of the cause. Many HC's
> >>>> have narcicistic tendancies, and fancy the idea that
> >>>> they are leader of the group, a revered contributor,
> >>>> and in many cases, also think of themselves as
> >>>> artistic leaders.
> >>>>
> >>>> Thats it.
> >>>>
> >>>> E
> >>>>
> >>>>>
> >>>>> Having read your various comments, a few things
> >>>>> should be addressed.
> >>>>> First, this operation was extensively planned well
> >>>>> in advance, and the
> >>>>> number one thing to Black Rock Intelligence was that
> >>>>> NO ONE be hurt.
> >>>>> If you people actually knew us, you'd know that we
> >>>>> have an extensive
> >>>>> background in doing things exactly like this. In
> >>>>> fact, we were on the
> >>>>> ground for some thirty minutes before ascent,
> >>>>> scoping the scene and
> >>>>> clearing people in order to minimize any possiblity
> >>>>> of injury to
> >>>>> others. We were aided by several people who were
> >>>>> recruited on the
> >>>>> playa the night of this burn (BRI has no idea who
> >>>>> they are, so don't
> >>>>> bother asking).
> >>>>>
> >>>>> Second, the operation was planned in conjunction
> >>>>> with the lunar
> >>>>> eclipse because Black Rock Intelligence knew that
> >>>>> another event at the
> >>>>> trash fence would draw the bulk of lunatics to it,
> >>>>> rather than to the
> >>>>> Man. In fact, one of our peripheral operatives aided
> >>>>> in getting as
> >>>>> many people to the fence event as possible to help
> >>>>> BRI achieve its
> >>>>> goal of zero injuries.
> >>>>>
> >>>>> Third, word went out across the playa days in
> >>>>> advance that Black Rock
> >>>>> Intelligence was pulling this op. This word
> >>>>> continued to go out right
> >>>>> up to the moment that our chief operator began the
> >>>>> arduous climb up
> >>>>> the guide wire. As you can all see from the results,
> >>>>> BRI performed
> >>>>> flawlessly in this regard.
> >>>>>
> >>>>> We could give a fuck less what you all think of us
> >>>>> for doing this.
> >>>>> Most of you are newbies who have been drawn in by
> >>>>> the semi-religious
> >>>>> nature of the event, or maybe just the easy drugs
> >>>>> and easier sex. You
> >>>>> have nothing to offer the event other than your
> >>>>> fucking money and
> >>>>> obedience. You spend the rest of your lives in
> >>>>> mortal fear of
> >>>>> everything that insurance companies tell you to
> >>>>> fear, and pretend that
> >>>>> you're free and clear because you spend four days at
> >>>>> a desert
> >>>>> bacchanal where spinelessness is not only encouraged
> >>>>> but genetically
> >>>>> replicated for implementation in successive
> >>>>> generations. In short, you
> >>>>> are the swine of which Thompson spoke. Get over
> >>>>> yourselves.
> >>>>>
> >>>>> Some of us live quite well without fear. Doing so
> >>>>> requires the
> >>>>> ultimate in what Burning Man used to represent:
> >>>>> personal
> >>>>> responsibility and individual liberty. That's all
> >>>>> been lost in the
> >>>>> last decade of Burning Man's history. Consider this
> >>>>> operation a
> >>>>> history lesson that was desperately needed.
> >>>>>
> >>>>> One final note: Black Rock Intelligence has been
> >>>>> permanently
> >>>>> disbanded. All other operatives have made the
> >>>>> ultimate sacrifice by
> >>>>> swallowing their L-pills to avoid being captured
> >>>>> alive. I am the sole
> >>>>> surviving member of BRI and ask that you respect my
> >>>>> mourning period
> >>>>> for those who gave their lives so that this
> >>>>> operation was a complete
> >>>>> success.
> >>>>>
> >>>>> Paul D. Addis
> >>>>> Fernley, NV
> >>>>>
> >>>>>
> >>>>> On 8/30/07, dangrsmind@yahoo.com
> >>>>> <dangrsmind@yahoo.com> wrote:

Subject: Re: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy Capitalists

------=_Part_7720_1987433.1188512990826
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Disposition: inline

No outdoor isn't wasteful by my definition. That's one of the reasons I
think they're obnoxious and I try to avoid them. "Leave no trace" is
emblematic of the whole attitudes of burners (or at least the burners I've
come into contact with). They love to try to convince themselves that
they're not causing harm, yet will not hesitate to drive a vehicle that gets
3mpg several hundred miles into the desert to sit and get completely wasted
on drugs (and syphilis!) for a week.

I can't say I've ever been, but I have been aware of it since the mid 90's
(back when it was still a worthwhile [though still wasteful] endeavor in my
estimation) and I've met, partied with, discussed politics with many a
burner and I think I have a pretty good idea of what they're about. Which is
to say, creating a playground for the silicon valley tech heads to use for a
week of decompression once a year. It has nothing to do with community, and
at 350 bucks a ticket (or whatever outrageous sum they're charging this
year), you can rest assured that profit is a motive hiding behind many of
the organizers claims of 'community' and 'organizing.'

I think that about sums it up. A lot of my complaints about burning man
would be alleviated if it were a 'anyone who wants to show up and contribute
can' type of thing instead of a 'give us all your money at the door,
motherfucker' type thing.

Seen?

>From: filter.sf@gmail.com
>To: "Dan Haskovec" <dan@pry.com>
>CC: pinkko <ealaughlin@gmail.com>, SFR <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
>Subject: Re: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy Capitalists
>Date: Thu, 30 Aug 2007 15:20:59 -0700
>
>Most of the naysayers are those pretty well familiar with the event
>enough to know all the issues and decide for themselves if it's all
>worth playing along and wasting resources for one week a year.
>
>The collaborative play narrative co-creation and opportunity to hang
>out with old friends for a meaningful amount of time is enough to make
>it mostly worth it, despite all the ridiculousness.
>
>That said, the last two years I went to the event looked like this:
>
>2004 - Relationship drama. Art project drama. Spent the weekend
>following Bassnectar producer Lorin back and forth from one end of the
>playa to another for lack of anything better to do or any decent art
>to play with. Could not find any techno. Enjoyed my Indian taco on the
>way home.
>
>2004 - More relationship drama. Art project succeeds (being a girl in
>distress with propane helps)! Campmates are all too stoned to be
>interesting so spend most of the time at Spock Mountain Research Labs
>with BORG 2 cohorts making fun of hippies and celebrating our failure.
>Best memory: a buddy pees on Paul Fukingmould's tourbus. Brooklyn's
>inter-node camp has some minimal techno, but for one night only.
>Indian taco express lane to Gerlach...
>
>-Solekandi
>
>

> > >>>>> Having read your various comments, a few things
> > >>>>> should be addressed.
> > >>>>> First, this operation was extensively planned well
> > >>>>> in advance, and the
> > >>>>> number one thing to Black Rock Intelligence was that
> > >>>>> NO ONE be hurt.
> > >>>>> If you people actually knew us, you'd know that we
> > >>>>> have an extensive
> > >>>>> background in doing things exactly like this. In
> > >>>>> fact, we were on the
> > >>>>> ground for some thirty minutes before ascent,
> > >>>>> scoping the scene and
> > >>>>> clearing people in order to minimize any possiblity
> > >>>>> of injury to
> > >>>>> others. We were aided by several people who were
> > >>>>> recruited on the
> > >>>>> playa the night of this burn (BRI has no idea who
> > >>>>> they are, so don't
> > >>>>> bother asking).
> > >>>>>
> > >>>>> Second, the operation was planned in conjunction
> > >>>>> with the lunar
> > >>>>> eclipse because Black Rock Intelligence knew that
> > >>>>> another event at the
> > >>>>> trash fence would draw the bulk of lunatics to it,
> > >>>>> rather than to the
> > >>>>> Man. In fact, one of our peripheral operatives aided
> > >>>>> in getting as
> > >>>>> many people to the fence event as possible to help
> > >>>>> BRI achieve its
> > >>>>> goal of zero injuries.
> > >>>>>
> > >>>>> Third, word went out across the playa days in
> > >>>>> advance that Black Rock
> > >>>>> Intelligence was pulling this op. This word
> > >>>>> continued to go out right
> > >>>>> up to the moment that our chief operator began the
> > >>>>> arduous climb up
> > >>>>> the guide wire. As you can all see from the results,
> > >>>>> BRI performed
> > >>>>> flawlessly in this regard.
> > >>>>>
> > >>>>> We could give a fuck less what you all think of us
> > >>>>> for doing this.
> > >>>>> Most of you are newbies who have been drawn in by
> > >>>>> the semi-religious
> > >>>>> nature of the event, or maybe just the easy drugs
> > >>>>> and easier sex. You
> > >>>>> have nothing to offer the event other than your
> > >>>>> fucking money and
> > >>>>> obedience. You spend the rest of your lives in
> > >>>>> mortal fear of
> > >>>>> everything that insurance companies tell you to
> > >>>>> fear, and pretend that
> > >>>>> you're free and clear because you spend four days at
> > >>>>> a desert
> > >>>>> bacchanal where spinelessness is not only encouraged
> > >>>>> but genetically
> > >>>>> replicated for implementation in successive
> > >>>>> generations. In short, you
> > >>>>> are the swine of which Thompson spoke. Get over
> > >>>>> yourselves.
> > >>>>>
> > >>>>> Some of us live quite well without fear. Doing so
> > >>>>> requires the
> > >>>>> ultimate in what Burning Man used to represent:
> > >>>>> personal
> > >>>>> responsibility and individual liberty. That's all
> > >>>>> been lost in the
> > >>>>> last decade of Burning Man's history. Consider this
> > >>>>> operation a
> > >>>>> history lesson that was desperately needed.
> > >>>>>
> > >>>>> One final note: Black Rock Intelligence has been
> > >>>>> permanently
> > >>>>> disbanded. All other operatives have made the
> > >>>>> ultimate sacrifice by
> > >>>>> swallowing their L-pills to avoid being captured
> > >>>>> alive. I am the sole
> > >>>>> surviving member of BRI and ask that you respect my
> > >>>>> mourning period
> > >>>>> for those who gave their lives so that this
> > >>>>> operation was a complete
> > >>>>> success.
> > >>>>>
> > >>>>> Paul D. Addis
> > >>>>> Fernley, NV
> > >>>>>
> > >>>>>
> > >>>>> On 8/30/07, dangrsmind@yahoo.com
> > >>>>> <dangrsmind@yahoo.com> wrote:
> > >>>>>> Some great discussion of the early burning of the
> > >>>>> man etc. at laughing squid.  Some quasi-intelligent
> > >>>>> comments too, so read the whole thing if you are
> > >>>>> interested in art and counterculture.
> > >>>>>>
> > >>>>>>

>http://laughingsquid.com/burning-man-set-on-fire-early-arson-is-to-blame

> > > >>>> It's a phrase I made up when the dead heads lost their
> > > >>>> parking lot and shows and started ruining the rave
> > > >>>> scene.
> > > >>>>
> > > >>>> HIPPY CAPITALISM
> > > >>>>
> > > >>>> DEFINED AS: Capitalists using hippy idealism for the
> > > >>>> purpose of seperating the idealists from their money
> > > >>>> via a mock-display of those same ideals. The HC
> > > >>>> usually takes on the appearance of the group they are
> > > >>>> extorting. The HC knows the lingo, mind-set, and
> > > >>>> culture of the sub-group they are targetting, and to
> > > >>>> many, appear to be a bullwark of the cause. Many HC's
> > > >>>> have narcicistic tendancies, and fancy the idea that
> > > >>>> they are leader of the group, a revered contributor,
> > > >>>> and in many cases, also think of themselves as
> > > >>>> artistic leaders.
> > > >>>>
> > > >>>> Thats it.
> > > >>>>

> > >From: filter.sf@gmail.com
> > >To: "Dan Haskovec" <dan@pry.com>
> > >CC: pinkko <ealaughlin@gmail.com>, SFR <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
> > >Subject: Re: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy Capitalists
> > >Date: Thu, 30 Aug 2007 15:20:59 -0700
> > >
> > >Most of the naysayers are those pretty well familiar with the event
> > >enough to know all the issues and decide for themselves if it's all
> > >worth playing along and wasting resources for one week a year.
> > >
> > >The collaborative play narrative co-creation and opportunity to hang
> > >out with old friends for a meaningful amount of time is enough to make
> > >it mostly worth it, despite all the ridiculousness.
> > >
> > >That said, the last two years I went to the event looked like this:
> > >
> > >2004 - Relationship drama. Art project drama. Spent the weekend
> > >following Bassnectar producer Lorin back and forth from one end of the
> > >playa to another for lack of anything better to do or any decent art
> > >to play with. Could not find any techno. Enjoyed my Indian taco on the
> > >way home.
> > >
> > >2004 - More relationship drama. Art project succeeds (being a girl in
> > >distress with propane helps)! Campmates are all too stoned to be
> > >interesting so spend most of the time at Spock Mountain Research Labs
> > >with BORG 2 cohorts making fun of hippies and celebrating our failure.
> > >Best memory: a buddy pees on Paul Fukingmould's tourbus. Brooklyn's
> > >inter-node camp has some minimal techno, but for one night only.
> > >Indian taco express lane to Gerlach...
> > >
> > >-Solekandi
> > >
> > >

> > > > >>>
> > > > >>>
> > > > >>>> From: Eric Spire <ericspire@yahoo.com>
> > > > >>>> To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
> > > > >>>> Subject: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy 
>Capitalists
> > > > >>>> Date: Thu, 30 Aug 2007 14:07:11 -0700 (PDT)
> > > > >>>>
> > > > >>>> That message was so DEAD ON. The only thing I would
> > > > >>>> add is a definition of what the writer does not
> > > > >>>> address exactly....
> > > > >>>>
> > > > >>>> It's a phrase I made up when the dead heads lost their
> > > > >>>> parking lot and shows and started ruining the rave
> > > > >>>> scene.
> > > > >>>>
> > > > >>>> HIPPY CAPITALISM
> > > > >>>>
> > > > >>>> DEFINED AS: Capitalists using hippy idealism for the
> > > > >>>> purpose of seperating the idealists from their money
> > > > >>>> via a mock-display of those same ideals. The HC
> > > > >>>> usually takes on the appearance of the group they are
> > > > >>>> extorting. The HC knows the lingo, mind-set, and
> > > > >>>> culture of the sub-group they are targetting, and to
> > > > >>>> many, appear to be a bullwark of the cause. Many HC's
> > > > >>>> have narcicistic tendancies, and fancy the idea that
> > > > >>>> they are leader of the group, a revered contributor,
> > > > >>>> and in many cases, also think of themselves as
> > > > >>>> artistic leaders.
> > > > >>>>
> > > > >>>> Thats it.
> > > > >>>>
> > > > >>>> E
> > > > >>>>
> > > > >>>>>
> > > > >>>>> Having read your various comments, a few things
> > > > >>>>> should be addressed.
> > > > >>>>> First, this operation was extensively planned well
> > > > >>>>> in advance, and the
> > > > >>>>> number one thing to Black Rock Intelligence was that
> > > > >>>>> NO ONE be hurt.
> > > > >>>>> If you people actually knew us, you'd know that we
> > > > >>>>> have an extensive
> > > > >>>>> background in doing things exactly like this. In
> > > > >>>>> fact, we were on the
> > > > >>>>> ground for some thirty minutes before ascent,
> > > > >>>>> scoping the scene and
> > > > >>>>> clearing people in order to minimize any possiblity
> > > > >>>>> of injury to
> > > > >>>>> others. We were aided by several people who were
> > > > >>>>> recruited on the
> > > > >>>>> playa the night of this burn (BRI has no idea who
> > > > >>>>> they are, so don't
> > > > >>>>> bother asking).
> > > > >>>>>
> > > > >>>>> Second, the operation was planned in conjunction
> > > > >>>>> with the lunar
> > > > >>>>> eclipse because Black Rock Intelligence knew that
> > > > >>>>> another event at the
> > > > >>>>> trash fence would draw the bulk of lunatics to it,
> > > > >>>>> rather than to the
> > > > >>>>> Man. In fact, one of our peripheral operatives aided
> > > > >>>>> in getting as
> > > > >>>>> many people to the fence event as possible to help
> > > > >>>>> BRI achieve its
> > > > >>>>> goal of zero injuries.
> > > > >>>>>
> > > > >>>>> Third, word went out across the playa days in
> > > > >>>>> advance that Black Rock
> > > > >>>>> Intelligence was pulling this op. This word
> > > > >>>>> continued to go out right
> > > > >>>>> up to the moment that our chief operator began the
> > > > >>>>> arduous climb up
> > > > >>>>> the guide wire. As you can all see from the results,
> > > > >>>>> BRI performed
> > > > >>>>> flawlessly in this regard.
> > > > >>>>>
> > > > >>>>> We could give a fuck less what you all think of us
> > > > >>>>> for doing this.
> > > > >>>>> Most of you are newbies who have been drawn in by
> > > > >>>>> the semi-religious
> > > > >>>>> nature of the event, or maybe just the easy drugs
> > > > >>>>> and easier sex. You
> > > > >>>>> have nothing to offer the event other than your
> > > > >>>>> fucking money and
> > > > >>>>> obedience. You spend the rest of your lives in
> > > > >>>>> mortal fear of
> > > > >>>>> everything that insurance companies tell you to
> > > > >>>>> fear, and pretend that
> > > > >>>>> you're free and clear because you spend four days at
> > > > >>>>> a desert
> > > > >>>>> bacchanal where spinelessness is not only encouraged
> > > > >>>>> but genetically
> > > > >>>>> replicated for implementation in successive
> > > > >>>>> generations. In short, you
> > > > >>>>> are the swine of which Thompson spoke. Get over
> > > > >>>>> yourselves.
> > > > >>>>>
> > > > >>>>> Some of us live quite well without fear. Doing so
> > > > >>>>> requires the
> > > > >>>>> ultimate in what Burning Man used to represent:
> > > > >>>>> personal
> > > > >>>>> responsibility and individual liberty. That's all
> > > > >>>>> been lost in the
> > > > >>>>> last decade of Burning Man's history. Consider this
> > > > >>>>> operation a
> > > > >>>>> history lesson that was desperately needed.
> > > > >>>>>
> > > > >>>>> One final note: Black Rock Intelligence has been
> > > > >>>>> permanently
> > > > >>>>> disbanded. All other operatives have made the
> > > > >>>>> ultimate sacrifice by
> > > > >>>>> swallowing their L-pills to avoid being captured
> > > > >>>>> alive. I am the sole
> > > > >>>>> surviving member of BRI and ask that you respect my
> > > > >>>>> mourning period
> > > > >>>>> for those who gave their lives so that this
> > > > >>>>> operation was a complete
> > > > >>>>> success.
> > > > >>>>>
> > > > >>>>> Paul D. Addis
> > > > >>>>> Fernley, NV
> > > > >>>>>
> > > > >>>>>
> > > > >>>>> On 8/30/07, dangrsmind@yahoo.com
> > > > >>>>> <dangrsmind@yahoo.com> wrote:
> > > > >>>>>> Some great discussion of the early burning of the
> > > > >>>>> man etc. at laughing squid.  Some quasi-intelligent
> > > > >>>>> comments too, so read the whole thing if you are

Subject: Re: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy Capitalists

Well, if you think that all recreational travel is to be condemned, 
there's not much to argue. It's a noble position but not one I'm willing 
to take. Those "3mpg" trucks haul gear for dozens of people, btw.

My one personal story relating to your "ticket ripoff" scenario: In '99, 
we picked up a kid in Reno who was hitching a ride to the playa. He had 
come up from Dallas by bus with just a big backpack. He bought a ticket at 
the door, wound up volunteering at the center camp cafe, and they refunded 
him the money for the ticket. He ended up camping with our group for the 
week (30 people that year, 20' truck and all - big hassle, we dropped the 
group and the truck for future years). Maybe this doesn't happen anymore 
though, and had it occurred in 2007, he would have given us all STDs....



On Thu, 30 Aug 2007, pinkko wrote:

> No outdoor isn't wasteful by my definition. That's one of the reasons I
> think they're obnoxious and I try to avoid them. "Leave no trace" is
> emblematic of the whole attitudes of burners (or at least the burners I've
> come into contact with). They love to try to convince themselves that
> they're not causing harm, yet will not hesitate to drive a vehicle that gets
> 3mpg several hundred miles into the desert to sit and get completely wasted
> on drugs (and syphilis!) for a week.
>
> I can't say I've ever been, but I have been aware of it since the mid 90's
> (back when it was still a worthwhile [though still wasteful] endeavor in my
> estimation) and I've met, partied with, discussed politics with many a
> burner and I think I have a pretty good idea of what they're about. Which is
> to say, creating a playground for the silicon valley tech heads to use for a
> week of decompression once a year. It has nothing to do with community, and
> at 350 bucks a ticket (or whatever outrageous sum they're charging this
> year), you can rest assured that profit is a motive hiding behind many of
> the organizers claims of 'community' and 'organizing.'
>
> I think that about sums it up. A lot of my complaints about burning man
> would be alleviated if it were a 'anyone who wants to show up and contribute
> can' type of thing instead of a 'give us all your money at the door,
> motherfucker' type thing.
>
> Seen?
>

>>>>>>> Having read your various comments, a few things
>>>>>>> should be addressed.
>>>>>>> First, this operation was extensively planned well
>>>>>>> in advance, and the
>>>>>>> number one thing to Black Rock Intelligence was that
>>>>>>> NO ONE be hurt.
>>>>>>> If you people actually knew us, you'd know that we
>>>>>>> have an extensive
>>>>>>> background in doing things exactly like this. In
>>>>>>> fact, we were on the
>>>>>>> ground for some thirty minutes before ascent,
>>>>>>> scoping the scene and
>>>>>>> clearing people in order to minimize any possiblity
>>>>>>> of injury to
>>>>>>> others. We were aided by several people who were
>>>>>>> recruited on the
>>>>>>> playa the night of this burn (BRI has no idea who
>>>>>>> they are, so don't
>>>>>>> bother asking).
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Second, the operation was planned in conjunction
>>>>>>> with the lunar
>>>>>>> eclipse because Black Rock Intelligence knew that
>>>>>>> another event at the
>>>>>>> trash fence would draw the bulk of lunatics to it,
>>>>>>> rather than to the
>>>>>>> Man. In fact, one of our peripheral operatives aided
>>>>>>> in getting as
>>>>>>> many people to the fence event as possible to help
>>>>>>> BRI achieve its
>>>>>>> goal of zero injuries.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Third, word went out across the playa days in
>>>>>>> advance that Black Rock
>>>>>>> Intelligence was pulling this op. This word
>>>>>>> continued to go out right
>>>>>>> up to the moment that our chief operator began the
>>>>>>> arduous climb up
>>>>>>> the guide wire. As you can all see from the results,
>>>>>>> BRI performed
>>>>>>> flawlessly in this regard.
>>>>>>>

>>>>>>> for doing this.
>>>>>>> Most of you are newbies who have been drawn in by
>>>>>>> the semi-religious
>>>>>>> nature of the event, or maybe just the easy drugs
>>>>>>> and easier sex. You
>>>>>>> have nothing to offer the event other than your
>>>>>>> fucking money and
>>>>>>> obedience. You spend the rest of your lives in
>>>>>>> mortal fear of
>>>>>>> everything that insurance companies tell you to
>>>>>>> fear, and pretend that
>>>>>>> you're free and clear because you spend four days at
>>>>>>> a desert
>>>>>>> bacchanal where spinelessness is not only encouraged
>>>>>>> but genetically
>>>>>>> replicated for implementation in successive
>>>>>>> generations. In short, you
>>>>>>> are the swine of which Thompson spoke. Get over
>>>>>>> yourselves.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Some of us live quite well without fear. Doing so
>>>>>>> requires the
>>>>>>> ultimate in what Burning Man used to represent:
>>>>>>> personal
>>>>>>> responsibility and individual liberty. That's all
>>>>>>> been lost in the
>>>>>>> last decade of Burning Man's history. Consider this
>>>>>>> operation a
>>>>>>> history lesson that was desperately needed.
>>>>>>>

>>>>>>> permanently
>>>>>>> disbanded. All other operatives have made the
>>>>>>> ultimate sacrifice by
>>>>>>> swallowing their L-pills to avoid being captured
>>>>>>> alive. I am the sole

Subject: Re: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy Capitalists

------=_Part_7862_480107.1188516415857
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Disposition: inline

I didn't say all recreational travel is to be condemned, just that I find it
obnoxious that people who will scream about 'leave no trace' will then get
into their horribly inefficient vehicles to go romp around in the wilderness
and create havoc for god only knows how much wildlife. Not to mention the
global warming concerns.

I mean, if you want to throw a huge ass wasteful party in the desert, feel
free, I'm not going to try and stop it, but don't go around couching
yourself in environmental values when you in reality have no such values. Or
certainly not values strong enough to prevent you from going on a hedonistic
adventure through a desert that would be much better off without your
presence there.

Like I said I tend to avoid outdoor parties to begin with. I think we have
more than enough unused, wasted space in our cities now that could be used
to throw much better parties than burning man that don't require the
movement of tens of thousands of people into usually pristine wilderness at
the cost of millions of gallons of gasoline and untold numbers of other
resources.

On 8/30/07, Dan Haskovec <dan@pry.com> wrote:
>
> Well, if you think that all recreational travel is to be condemned,
> there's not much to argue. It's a noble position but not one I'm willing
> to take. Those "3mpg" trucks haul gear for dozens of people, btw.
>
> My one personal story relating to your "ticket ripoff" scenario: In '99,
> we picked up a kid in Reno who was hitching a ride to the playa. He had
> come up from Dallas by bus with just a big backpack. He bought a ticket at
> the door, wound up volunteering at the center camp cafe, and they refunded
> him the money for the ticket. He ended up camping with our group for the
> week (30 people that year, 20' truck and all - big hassle, we dropped the
> group and the truck for future years). Maybe this doesn't happen anymore
> though, and had it occurred in 2007, he would have given us all STDs....
>
>
>
> On Thu, 30 Aug 2007, pinkko wrote:
>
> > No outdoor isn't wasteful by my definition. That's one of the reasons I
> > think they're obnoxious and I try to avoid them. "Leave no trace" is
> > emblematic of the whole attitudes of burners (or at least the burners
> I've
> > come into contact with). They love to try to convince themselves that
> > they're not causing harm, yet will not hesitate to drive a vehicle that
> gets
> > 3mpg several hundred miles into the desert to sit and get completely

> > on drugs (and syphilis!) for a week.

> 90's
> > (back when it was still a worthwhile [though still wasteful] endeavor in
> my

> > burner and I think I have a pretty good idea of what they're about.
> Which is
> > to say, creating a playground for the silicon valley tech heads to use
> for a
> > week of decompression once a year. It has nothing to do with community,
> and
> > at 350 bucks a ticket (or whatever outrageous sum they're charging this
> > year), you can rest assured that profit is a motive hiding behind many
> of
> > the organizers claims of 'community' and 'organizing.'
> >
> > I think that about sums it up. A lot of my complaints about burning man
> > would be alleviated if it were a 'anyone who wants to show up and

> >>>>>> From: Eric Spire <ericspire@yahoo.com>
> >>>>>> To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
> >>>>>> Subject: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy Capitalists
> >>>>>> Date: Thu, 30 Aug 2007 14:07:11 -0700 (PDT)
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> That message was so DEAD ON. The only thing I would
> >>>>>> add is a definition of what the writer does not
> >>>>>> address exactly....
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> It's a phrase I made up when the dead heads lost their
> >>>>>> parking lot and shows and started ruining the rave
> >>>>>> scene.
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> HIPPY CAPITALISM
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> DEFINED AS: Capitalists using hippy idealism for the
> >>>>>> purpose of seperating the idealists from their money
> >>>>>> via a mock-display of those same ideals. The HC
> >>>>>> usually takes on the appearance of the group they are
> >>>>>> extorting. The HC knows the lingo, mind-set, and
> >>>>>> culture of the sub-group they are targetting, and to
> >>>>>> many, appear to be a bullwark of the cause. Many HC's
> >>>>>> have narcicistic tendancies, and fancy the idea that
> >>>>>> they are leader of the group, a revered contributor,
> >>>>>> and in many cases, also think of themselves as
> >>>>>> artistic leaders.
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> Thats it.
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> E
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>>>
> >>>>>>> Having read your various comments, a few things
> >>>>>>> should be addressed.
> >>>>>>> First, this operation was extensively planned well
> >>>>>>> in advance, and the
> >>>>>>> number one thing to Black Rock Intelligence was that
> >>>>>>> NO ONE be hurt.
> >>>>>>> If you people actually knew us, you'd know that we
> >>>>>>> have an extensive
> >>>>>>> background in doing things exactly like this. In
> >>>>>>> fact, we were on the
> >>>>>>> ground for some thirty minutes before ascent,
> >>>>>>> scoping the scene and
> >>>>>>> clearing people in order to minimize any possiblity
> >>>>>>> of injury to
> >>>>>>> others. We were aided by several people who were
> >>>>>>> recruited on the
> >>>>>>> playa the night of this burn (BRI has no idea who
> >>>>>>> they are, so don't
> >>>>>>> bother asking).
> >>>>>>>
> >>>>>>> Second, the operation was planned in conjunction
> >>>>>>> with the lunar
> >>>>>>> eclipse because Black Rock Intelligence knew that
> >>>>>>> another event at the
> >>>>>>> trash fence would draw the bulk of lunatics to it,
> >>>>>>> rather than to the
> >>>>>>> Man. In fact, one of our peripheral operatives aided
> >>>>>>> in getting as
> >>>>>>> many people to the fence event as possible to help
> >>>>>>> BRI achieve its
> >>>>>>> goal of zero injuries.
> >>>>>>>
> >>>>>>> Third, word went out across the playa days in
> >>>>>>> advance that Black Rock
> >>>>>>> Intelligence was pulling this op. This word
> >>>>>>> continued to go out right
> >>>>>>> up to the moment that our chief operator began the
> >>>>>>> arduous climb up
> >>>>>>> the guide wire. As you can all see from the results,
> >>>>>>> BRI performed
> >>>>>>> flawlessly in this regard.
> >>>>>>>
> >>>>>>> We could give a fuck less what you all think of us
> >>>>>>> for doing this.
> >>>>>>> Most of you are newbies who have been drawn in by
> >>>>>>> the semi-religious
> >>>>>>> nature of the event, or maybe just the easy drugs
> >>>>>>> and easier sex. You
> >>>>>>> have nothing to offer the event other than your
> >>>>>>> fucking money and
> >>>>>>> obedience. You spend the rest of your lives in
> >>>>>>> mortal fear of
> >>>>>>> everything that insurance companies tell you to
> >>>>>>> fear, and pretend that
> >>>>>>> you're free and clear because you spend four days at
> >>>>>>> a desert
> >>>>>>> bacchanal where spinelessness is not only encouraged
> >>>>>>> but genetically
> >>>>>>> replicated for implementation in successive
> >>>>>>> generations. In short, you
> >>>>>>> are the swine of which Thompson spoke. Get over
> >>>>>>> yourselves.
> >>>>>>>
> >>>>>>> Some of us live quite well without fear. Doing so
> >>>>>>> requires the
> >>>>>>> ultimate in what Burning Man used to represent:
> >>>>>>> personal
> >>>>>>> responsibility and individual liberty. That's all
> >>>>>>> been lost in the
> >>>>>>> last decade of Burning Man's history. Consider this
> >>>>>>> operation a
> >>>>>>> history lesson that was desperately needed.
> >>>>>>>
> >>>>>>> One final note: Black Rock Intelligence has been
> >>>>>>> permanently
> >>>>>>> disbanded. All other operatives have made the
> >>>>>>> ultimate sacrifice by
> >>>>>>> swallowing their L-pills to avoid being captured
> >>>>>>> alive. I am the sole
> >>>>>>> surviving member of BRI and ask that you respect my
> >>>>>>> mourning period
> >>>>>>> for those who gave their lives so that this
> >>>>>>> operation was a complete
> >>>>>>> success.
> >>>>>>>
> >>>>>>> Paul D. Addis
> >>>>>>> Fernley, NV

Subject: Re: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy Capitalists

Ah, so it's not the consumption you're concerned with, it's that you 
disapprove on aesthetic grounds! Again, I can't argue that.

There is no flora or fauna on the playa, it's a seasonally dry alkaline 
lakebed. Think drywall dust. That's the whole point of holding the event 
there. Here's a fine illustration of the location:

http://pic.templetons.com/cgi-bin/imget?d=brad/photo/bm06/plane&fn=img_7927.jpg

The BLM sets very strict usage requirements, they don't even allow fires 
directly on the ground anymore because it bakes the clay and is too 
difficult to restore. Most of the art cars are pretty darn efficient, ours 
was based on an old Volvo station wagon and could transport 20 people. 
Cargo trucks are more efficient than hauling the same amount of weight in 
passenger cars.

If you want to get technical, air travel is much more environmentally 
destructive than driving several hundred miles for a week's vacation. 
People flying to Costa Rica on eco-vacations burn a lot more fuel than 
people driving to Nevada. It's pointless to argue that one is somehow more 
worthwhile than the other if you're not the person making the decision to 
partake.


On Thu, 30 Aug 2007, pinkko wrote:

> I didn't say all recreational travel is to be condemned, just that I find it
> obnoxious that people who will scream about 'leave no trace' will then get
> into their horribly inefficient vehicles to go romp around in the wilderness
> and create havoc for god only knows how much wildlife. Not to mention the
> global warming concerns.
>
> I mean, if you want to throw a huge ass wasteful party in the desert, feel
> free, I'm not going to try and stop it, but don't go around couching
> yourself in environmental values when you in reality have no such values. Or
> certainly not values strong enough to prevent you from going on a hedonistic
> adventure through a desert that would be much better off without your
> presence there.
>
> Like I said I tend to avoid outdoor parties to begin with. I think we have
> more than enough unused, wasted space in our cities now that could be used
> to throw much better parties than burning man that don't require the
> movement of tens of thousands of people into usually pristine wilderness at
> the cost of millions of gallons of gasoline and untold numbers of other
> resources.
>
> On 8/30/07, Dan Haskovec <dan@pry.com> wrote:
>>
>> Well, if you think that all recreational travel is to be condemned,
>> there's not much to argue. It's a noble position but not one I'm willing
>> to take. Those "3mpg" trucks haul gear for dozens of people, btw.
>>
>> My one personal story relating to your "ticket ripoff" scenario: In '99,
>> we picked up a kid in Reno who was hitching a ride to the playa. He had
>> come up from Dallas by bus with just a big backpack. He bought a ticket at
>> the door, wound up volunteering at the center camp cafe, and they refunded
>> him the money for the ticket. He ended up camping with our group for the
>> week (30 people that year, 20' truck and all - big hassle, we dropped the
>> group and the truck for future years). Maybe this doesn't happen anymore
>> though, and had it occurred in 2007, he would have given us all STDs....
>>
>>
>>

>>> come into contact with). They love to try to convince themselves that
>>> they're not causing harm, yet will not hesitate to drive a vehicle that
>> gets

>> wasted
>>> on drugs (and syphilis!) for a week.

>> Which is

>> for a

>> and
>>> at 350 bucks a ticket (or whatever outrageous sum they're charging this
>>> year), you can rest assured that profit is a motive hiding behind many
>> of
>>> the organizers claims of 'community' and 'organizing.'
>>>

>>> would be alleviated if it were a 'anyone who wants to show up and

>>> motherfucker' type thing.

>>>>>>>> From: Eric Spire <ericspire@yahoo.com>

>>>>>>>> Subject: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy Capitalists
>>>>>>>> Date: Thu, 30 Aug 2007 14:07:11 -0700 (PDT)
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> That message was so DEAD ON. The only thing I would
>>>>>>>> add is a definition of what the writer does not
>>>>>>>> address exactly....
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> It's a phrase I made up when the dead heads lost their
>>>>>>>> parking lot and shows and started ruining the rave
>>>>>>>> scene.
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> HIPPY CAPITALISM
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> DEFINED AS: Capitalists using hippy idealism for the
>>>>>>>> purpose of seperating the idealists from their money
>>>>>>>> via a mock-display of those same ideals. The HC
>>>>>>>> usually takes on the appearance of the group they are
>>>>>>>> extorting. The HC knows the lingo, mind-set, and
>>>>>>>> culture of the sub-group they are targetting, and to
>>>>>>>> many, appear to be a bullwark of the cause. Many HC's
>>>>>>>> have narcicistic tendancies, and fancy the idea that
>>>>>>>> they are leader of the group, a revered contributor,
>>>>>>>> and in many cases, also think of themselves as
>>>>>>>> artistic leaders.
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> Thats it.
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> E
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> Having read your various comments, a few things
>>>>>>>>> should be addressed.
>>>>>>>>> First, this operation was extensively planned well
>>>>>>>>> in advance, and the
>>>>>>>>> number one thing to Black Rock Intelligence was that
>>>>>>>>> NO ONE be hurt.
>>>>>>>>> If you people actually knew us, you'd know that we
>>>>>>>>> have an extensive
>>>>>>>>> background in doing things exactly like this. In
>>>>>>>>> fact, we were on the
>>>>>>>>> ground for some thirty minutes before ascent,
>>>>>>>>> scoping the scene and
>>>>>>>>> clearing people in order to minimize any possiblity
>>>>>>>>> of injury to
>>>>>>>>> others. We were aided by several people who were
>>>>>>>>> recruited on the
>>>>>>>>> playa the night of this burn (BRI has no idea who
>>>>>>>>> they are, so don't
>>>>>>>>> bother asking).
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> Second, the operation was planned in conjunction
>>>>>>>>> with the lunar
>>>>>>>>> eclipse because Black Rock Intelligence knew that
>>>>>>>>> another event at the
>>>>>>>>> trash fence would draw the bulk of lunatics to it,
>>>>>>>>> rather than to the
>>>>>>>>> Man. In fact, one of our peripheral operatives aided
>>>>>>>>> in getting as
>>>>>>>>> many people to the fence event as possible to help
>>>>>>>>> BRI achieve its
>>>>>>>>> goal of zero injuries.
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> Third, word went out across the playa days in
>>>>>>>>> advance that Black Rock
>>>>>>>>> Intelligence was pulling this op. This word
>>>>>>>>> continued to go out right
>>>>>>>>> up to the moment that our chief operator began the
>>>>>>>>> arduous climb up
>>>>>>>>> the guide wire. As you can all see from the results,
>>>>>>>>> BRI performed
>>>>>>>>> flawlessly in this regard.
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> We could give a fuck less what you all think of us
>>>>>>>>> for doing this.
>>>>>>>>> Most of you are newbies who have been drawn in by
>>>>>>>>> the semi-religious
>>>>>>>>> nature of the event, or maybe just the easy drugs
>>>>>>>>> and easier sex. You
>>>>>>>>> have nothing to offer the event other than your
>>>>>>>>> fucking money and
>>>>>>>>> obedience. You spend the rest of your lives in
>>>>>>>>> mortal fear of
>>>>>>>>> everything that insurance companies tell you to
>>>>>>>>> fear, and pretend that
>>>>>>>>> you're free and clear because you spend four days at
>>>>>>>>> a desert
>>>>>>>>> bacchanal where spinelessness is not only encouraged
>>>>>>>>> but genetically
>>>>>>>>> replicated for implementation in successive
>>>>>>>>> generations. In short, you
>>>>>>>>> are the swine of which Thompson spoke. Get over
>>>>>>>>> yourselves.
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> Some of us live quite well without fear. Doing so
>>>>>>>>> requires the
>>>>>>>>> ultimate in what Burning Man used to represent:
>>>>>>>>> personal
>>>>>>>>> responsibility and individual liberty. That's all
>>>>>>>>> been lost in the
>>>>>>>>> last decade of Burning Man's history. Consider this
>>>>>>>>> operation a
>>>>>>>>> history lesson that was desperately needed.
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> One final note: Black Rock Intelligence has been
>>>>>>>>> permanently
>>>>>>>>> disbanded. All other operatives have made the
>>>>>>>>> ultimate sacrifice by
>>>>>>>>> swallowing their L-pills to avoid being captured
>>>>>>>>> alive. I am the sole
>>>>>>>>> surviving member of BRI and ask that you respect my
>>>>>>>>> mourning period
>>>>>>>>> for those who gave their lives so that this
>>>>>>>>> operation was a complete
>>>>>>>>> success.
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>> Paul D. Addis
>>>>>>>>> Fernley, NV

Subject: Re: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy Capitalists

Pinkko,

You supremely nailed it...everything you state below is exactly why a
number of us list care so much about keep the parties urban and
accessible to those with no yearn to burn and everything associated
with that.

BSP in another post - but there's a lot happening in SF this weekend
without a care to what's going out in the desert.

But because BM does, unfortunately still matter and admittedly shapes
a lot of the tastes and recreational year-round activities in the Bay
Area, we are all kind of responsible here.

Here's where I want to point out the Sapphire Portal project at 1:11.
This joint Brooklyn/Boulder project countered the sentiments of most
minimal/techno heads and wound up bringing what could be the most
signficant techno project to the Playa ever.

Understanding the problem of BM, they're merely creating the
environment they want where it's going to have the most influence on
the masses rather than keeping it exclusive.

I was completely blown away when Dustfish - which is pretty heavy on
the breaks - invited us to bring minimal techno to their camp.

This is all a very good thing, indeed, at least for those of us
painfully aware of the barriers to techno that have existed previously
due to the BM factor.

-SK







On 8/30/07, pinkko <ealaughlin@gmail.com> wrote:
> I didn't say all recreational travel is to be condemned, just that I find it
> obnoxious that people who will scream about 'leave no trace' will then get
> into their horribly inefficient vehicles to go romp around in the wilderness
> and create havoc for god only knows how much wildlife. Not to mention the
> global warming concerns.

> I mean, if you want to throw a huge ass wasteful party in the desert, feel

> to throw much better parties than burning man that don't require the
> movement of tens of thousands of people into usually pristine wilderness at

> > >>> Also, the STDs.
> > >>>
> > >>> On 8/30/07, Dan Haskovec <dan@pry.com> wrote:
> > >>>>
> > >>>> Why so much schadenfreude over people having some fun in the desert?
> > I
> > >>>> really don't get it. What is it about bm attendees that pushes
> > >>>> non-attendees' buttons so much?
> > >>>>

> > >>>>>> From: Eric Spire <ericspire@yahoo.com>
> > >>>>>> To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
> > >>>>>> Subject: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy Capitalists
> > >>>>>> Date: Thu, 30 Aug 2007 14:07:11 -0700 (PDT)
> > >>>>>>
> > >>>>>> That message was so DEAD ON. The only thing I would
> > >>>>>> add is a definition of what the writer does not
> > >>>>>> address exactly....
> > >>>>>>
> > >>>>>> It's a phrase I made up when the dead heads lost their
> > >>>>>> parking lot and shows and started ruining the rave
> > >>>>>> scene.
> > >>>>>>
> > >>>>>> HIPPY CAPITALISM
> > >>>>>>
> > >>>>>> DEFINED AS: Capitalists using hippy idealism for the
> > >>>>>> purpose of seperating the idealists from their money
> > >>>>>> via a mock-display of those same ideals. The HC
> > >>>>>> usually takes on the appearance of the group they are
> > >>>>>> extorting. The HC knows the lingo, mind-set, and
> > >>>>>> culture of the sub-group they are targetting, and to
> > >>>>>> many, appear to be a bullwark of the cause. Many HC's
> > >>>>>> have narcicistic tendancies, and fancy the idea that
> > >>>>>> they are leader of the group, a revered contributor,
> > >>>>>> and in many cases, also think of themselves as
> > >>>>>> artistic leaders.
> > >>>>>>
> > >>>>>> Thats it.
> > >>>>>>
> > >>>>>> E
> > >>>>>>
> > >>>>>>>
> > >>>>>>> Having read your various comments, a few things
> > >>>>>>> should be addressed.
> > >>>>>>> First, this operation was extensively planned well
> > >>>>>>> in advance, and the
> > >>>>>>> number one thing to Black Rock Intelligence was that
> > >>>>>>> NO ONE be hurt.
> > >>>>>>> If you people actually knew us, you'd know that we
> > >>>>>>> have an extensive
> > >>>>>>> background in doing things exactly like this. In
> > >>>>>>> fact, we were on the
> > >>>>>>> ground for some thirty minutes before ascent,
> > >>>>>>> scoping the scene and
> > >>>>>>> clearing people in order to minimize any possiblity
> > >>>>>>> of injury to
> > >>>>>>> others. We were aided by several people who were
> > >>>>>>> recruited on the
> > >>>>>>> playa the night of this burn (BRI has no idea who
> > >>>>>>> they are, so don't
> > >>>>>>> bother asking).
> > >>>>>>>
> > >>>>>>> Second, the operation was planned in conjunction
> > >>>>>>> with the lunar
> > >>>>>>> eclipse because Black Rock Intelligence knew that
> > >>>>>>> another event at the
> > >>>>>>> trash fence would draw the bulk of lunatics to it,
> > >>>>>>> rather than to the
> > >>>>>>> Man. In fact, one of our peripheral operatives aided
> > >>>>>>> in getting as
> > >>>>>>> many people to the fence event as possible to help
> > >>>>>>> BRI achieve its
> > >>>>>>> goal of zero injuries.
> > >>>>>>>
> > >>>>>>> Third, word went out across the playa days in
> > >>>>>>> advance that Black Rock
> > >>>>>>> Intelligence was pulling this op. This word
> > >>>>>>> continued to go out right
> > >>>>>>> up to the moment that our chief operator began the
> > >>>>>>> arduous climb up
> > >>>>>>> the guide wire. As you can all see from the results,
> > >>>>>>> BRI performed
> > >>>>>>> flawlessly in this regard.
> > >>>>>>>
> > >>>>>>> We could give a fuck less what you all think of us
> > >>>>>>> for doing this.
> > >>>>>>> Most of you are newbies who have been drawn in by
> > >>>>>>> the semi-religious
> > >>>>>>> nature of the event, or maybe just the easy drugs
> > >>>>>>> and easier sex. You
> > >>>>>>> have nothing to offer the event other than your
> > >>>>>>> fucking money and
> > >>>>>>> obedience. You spend the rest of your lives in
> > >>>>>>> mortal fear of
> > >>>>>>> everything that insurance companies tell you to
> > >>>>>>> fear, and pretend that
> > >>>>>>> you're free and clear because you spend four days at
> > >>>>>>> a desert
> > >>>>>>> bacchanal where spinelessness is not only encouraged
> > >>>>>>> but genetically
> > >>>>>>> replicated for implementation in successive
> > >>>>>>> generations. In short, you
> > >>>>>>> are the swine of which Thompson spoke. Get over
> > >>>>>>> yourselves.
> > >>>>>>>
> > >>>>>>> Some of us live quite well without fear. Doing so
> > >>>>>>> requires the
> > >>>>>>> ultimate in what Burning Man used to represent:
> > >>>>>>> personal
> > >>>>>>> responsibility and individual liberty. That's all
> > >>>>>>> been lost in the
> > >>>>>>> last decade of Burning Man's history. Consider this
> > >>>>>>> operation a
> > >>>>>>> history lesson that was desperately needed.
> > >>>>>>>
> > >>>>>>> One final note: Black Rock Intelligence has been
> > >>>>>>> permanently
> > >>>>>>> disbanded. All other operatives have made the
> > >>>>>>> ultimate sacrifice by
> > >>>>>>> swallowing their L-pills to avoid being captured
> > >>>>>>> alive. I am the sole
> > >>>>>>> surviving member of BRI and ask that you respect my
> > >>>>>>> mourning period
> > >>>>>>> for those who gave their lives so that this
> > >>>>>>> operation was a complete
> > >>>>>>> success.
> > >>>>>>>
> > >>>>>>> Paul D. Addis
> > >>>>>>> Fernley, NV
> > >>>>>>>
> > >>>>>>>

Subject: Re: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy Capitalists

Fair enough, like I said if they want to throw burning man every year I'm
not going to stop them. It is, as you said essentially a matter of taste
(both social and environmental, I don't like hippie types, or yuppie types,
nor do I like the idea of being out in the middle of nowhere for a week). I
do think, however, that a bunch of people getting together to get fucked up
in the middle of nowhere for a week ought to at least be honest about it and
say that's what they're doing. Instead of claiming to be all forward
thinking and community minded. Which of humanities problems has burning man
ever solved? Or even begun to consider how to solve? It's a fucking party,
get over it.

You're not artists, you're asshats with nothing better to do.

This guy's got the ride idea:
http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/blogs/sfgate/detail?blogid=3&entry_id=19890

If only they'd go Jonestown, the world would be such a better place.

j/k

:-)

On 8/30/07, Dan Haskovec <dan@pry.com> wrote:
>
> Ah, so it's not the consumption you're concerned with, it's that you
> disapprove on aesthetic grounds! Again, I can't argue that.
>
> There is no flora or fauna on the playa, it's a seasonally dry alkaline
> lakebed. Think drywall dust. That's the whole point of holding the event
> there. Here's a fine illustration of the location:
>
>
> http://pic.templetons.com/cgi-bin/imget?d=brad/photo/bm06/plane&fn=img_7927.jpg
>
> The BLM sets very strict usage requirements, they don't even allow fires
> directly on the ground anymore because it bakes the clay and is too
> difficult to restore. Most of the art cars are pretty darn efficient, ours
> was based on an old Volvo station wagon and could transport 20 people.
> Cargo trucks are more efficient than hauling the same amount of weight in
> passenger cars.
>
> If you want to get technical, air travel is much more environmentally
> destructive than driving several hundred miles for a week's vacation.
> People flying to Costa Rica on eco-vacations burn a lot more fuel than
> people driving to Nevada. It's pointless to argue that one is somehow more
> worthwhile than the other if you're not the person making the decision to
> partake.
>
>
> On Thu, 30 Aug 2007, pinkko wrote:
>
> > I didn't say all recreational travel is to be condemned, just that I
> find it
> > obnoxious that people who will scream about 'leave no trace' will then
> get
> > into their horribly inefficient vehicles to go romp around in the
> wilderness
> > and create havoc for god only knows how much wildlife. Not to mention
> the
> > global warming concerns.
> >
> > I mean, if you want to throw a huge ass wasteful party in the desert,
> feel
> > free, I'm not going to try and stop it, but don't go around couching
> > yourself in environmental values when you in reality have no such
> values. Or
> > certainly not values strong enough to prevent you from going on a
> hedonistic
> > adventure through a desert that would be much better off without your
> > presence there.
> >
> > Like I said I tend to avoid outdoor parties to begin with. I think we
> have
> > more than enough unused, wasted space in our cities now that could be
> used
> > to throw much better parties than burning man that don't require the
> > movement of tens of thousands of people into usually pristine wilderness
> at
> > the cost of millions of gallons of gasoline and untold numbers of other
> > resources.
> >
> > On 8/30/07, Dan Haskovec <dan@pry.com> wrote:
> >>
> >> Well, if you think that all recreational travel is to be condemned,
> >> there's not much to argue. It's a noble position but not one I'm
> willing
> >> to take. Those "3mpg" trucks haul gear for dozens of people, btw.
> >>
> >> My one personal story relating to your "ticket ripoff" scenario: In
> '99,
> >> we picked up a kid in Reno who was hitching a ride to the playa. He had
> >> come up from Dallas by bus with just a big backpack. He bought a ticket
> at
> >> the door, wound up volunteering at the center camp cafe, and they
> refunded
> >> him the money for the ticket. He ended up camping with our group for
> the
> >> week (30 people that year, 20' truck and all - big hassle, we dropped
> the
> >> group and the truck for future years). Maybe this doesn't happen
> anymore
> >> though, and had it occurred in 2007, he would have given us all
> STDs....
> >>
> >>
> >>
> >> On Thu, 30 Aug 2007, pinkko wrote:
> >>
> >>> No outdoor isn't wasteful by my definition. That's one of the reasons
> I
> >>> think they're obnoxious and I try to avoid them. "Leave no trace" is
> >>> emblematic of the whole attitudes of burners (or at least the burners
> >> I've
> >>> come into contact with). They love to try to convince themselves that
> >>> they're not causing harm, yet will not hesitate to drive a vehicle
> that
> >> gets
> >>> 3mpg several hundred miles into the desert to sit and get completely
> >> wasted
> >>> on drugs (and syphilis!) for a week.
> >>>
> >>> I can't say I've ever been, but I have been aware of it since the mid
> >> 90's
> >>> (back when it was still a worthwhile [though still wasteful] endeavor
> in
> >> my
> >>> estimation) and I've met, partied with, discussed politics with many a
> >>> burner and I think I have a pretty good idea of what they're about.
> >> Which is
> >>> to say, creating a playground for the silicon valley tech heads to use
> >> for a
> >>> week of decompression once a year. It has nothing to do with
> community,
> >> and
> >>> at 350 bucks a ticket (or whatever outrageous sum they're charging
> this
> >>> year), you can rest assured that profit is a motive hiding behind many
> >> of
> >>> the organizers claims of 'community' and 'organizing.'
> >>>
> >>> I think that about sums it up. A lot of my complaints about burning
> man
> >>> would be alleviated if it were a 'anyone who wants to show up and
> >> contribute
> >>> can' type of thing instead of a 'give us all your money at the door,
> >>> motherfucker' type thing.
> >>>
> >>> Seen?
> >>>
> >>>

Subject: [sfraves] [BSP] :: Labor Day Weekend Techno for Urban Warriors

No labor day getaway for you? Don't dismay. Hit the pavement and
celebrate the wonders of the urban world. Thanks to 222 Hyde, Anu and
the End Up, techno flourishes in SF, so give them your patronage.

*Remember, the Bay Bridge closes at 8:00 PM for the weekend.
Bart runs all night hourly after Midnight:

http://www.bart.gov/news/press/news20070801.asp

::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

Friday, Aug. 31: Filter.SF at Anu with special guest Marius Neukom aka
New.Com [Comfornoise, Zurich]
DJs: Kontakt, Solekandi, Marius Neukom
Cover: no cover b4 11 pm, $5 after
Anu-Bar: 43 Sixth St


Saturday, Sept 1: Nummy at 222 Hyde
DJs: Claude VonStroke, Bryan James, Qzen, David Skye
Cover: $5
222 Club: 222 Hyde


Saturday, Sept. 1: Kontrol at the End Up featuring John Tejada
DJs: John Tejada, Eli Bingham, Nikola Baytala, Sammy D, Craig Kuna,
Alland Byallo
Cover: no cover b4 11pm, $15 after
The End Up: 401 Sixth St. SF

> On 8/30/07, Dan Haskovec <dan@pry.com> wrote:
>>
>> Ah, so it's not the consumption you're concerned with, it's that you
>> disapprove on aesthetic grounds! Again, I can't argue that.
>>
>> There is no flora or fauna on the playa, it's a seasonally dry alkaline
>> lakebed. Think drywall dust. That's the whole point of holding the event
>> there. Here's a fine illustration of the location:
>>
>>
>> http://pic.templetons.com/cgi-bin/imget?d=brad/photo/bm06/plane&fn=img_7927.jpg
>>
>> The BLM sets very strict usage requirements, they don't even allow fires
>> directly on the ground anymore because it bakes the clay and is too
>> difficult to restore. Most of the art cars are pretty darn efficient, ours
>> was based on an old Volvo station wagon and could transport 20 people.
>> Cargo trucks are more efficient than hauling the same amount of weight in
>> passenger cars.
>>
>> If you want to get technical, air travel is much more environmentally
>> destructive than driving several hundred miles for a week's vacation.
>> People flying to Costa Rica on eco-vacations burn a lot more fuel than
>> people driving to Nevada. It's pointless to argue that one is somehow more
>> worthwhile than the other if you're not the person making the decision to
>> partake.
>>
>>
>> On Thu, 30 Aug 2007, pinkko wrote:
>>

>> find it
>>> obnoxious that people who will scream about 'leave no trace' will then
>> get

>> wilderness
>>> and create havoc for god only knows how much wildlife. Not to mention
>> the
>>> global warming concerns.
>>>

>>> certainly not values strong enough to prevent you from going on a
>> hedonistic

>> have
>>> more than enough unused, wasted space in our cities now that could be

>>> to throw much better parties than burning man that don't require the

>> '99,

>>>> come up from Dallas by bus with just a big backpack. He bought a ticket
>> at
>>>> the door, wound up volunteering at the center camp cafe, and they
>> refunded

>> the

>> the

>> anymore

>>>>>>>>>> Subject: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy Capitalists

>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> That message was so DEAD ON. The only thing I would
>>>>>>>>>> add is a definition of what the writer does not
>>>>>>>>>> address exactly....
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> It's a phrase I made up when the dead heads lost their
>>>>>>>>>> parking lot and shows and started ruining the rave
>>>>>>>>>> scene.
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> HIPPY CAPITALISM
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> DEFINED AS: Capitalists using hippy idealism for the
>>>>>>>>>> purpose of seperating the idealists from their money
>>>>>>>>>> via a mock-display of those same ideals. The HC
>>>>>>>>>> usually takes on the appearance of the group they are
>>>>>>>>>> extorting. The HC knows the lingo, mind-set, and
>>>>>>>>>> culture of the sub-group they are targetting, and to
>>>>>>>>>> many, appear to be a bullwark of the cause. Many HC's
>>>>>>>>>> have narcicistic tendancies, and fancy the idea that
>>>>>>>>>> they are leader of the group, a revered contributor,
>>>>>>>>>> and in many cases, also think of themselves as
>>>>>>>>>> artistic leaders.
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> Thats it.
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> E
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>> Having read your various comments, a few things
>>>>>>>>>>> should be addressed.
>>>>>>>>>>> First, this operation was extensively planned well
>>>>>>>>>>> in advance, and the
>>>>>>>>>>> number one thing to Black Rock Intelligence was that
>>>>>>>>>>> NO ONE be hurt.
>>>>>>>>>>> If you people actually knew us, you'd know that we
>>>>>>>>>>> have an extensive
>>>>>>>>>>> background in doing things exactly like this. In
>>>>>>>>>>> fact, we were on the
>>>>>>>>>>> ground for some thirty minutes before ascent,
>>>>>>>>>>> scoping the scene and
>>>>>>>>>>> clearing people in order to minimize any possiblity
>>>>>>>>>>> of injury to
>>>>>>>>>>> others. We were aided by several people who were
>>>>>>>>>>> recruited on the
>>>>>>>>>>> playa the night of this burn (BRI has no idea who
>>>>>>>>>>> they are, so don't
>>>>>>>>>>> bother asking).
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>> Second, the operation was planned in conjunction
>>>>>>>>>>> with the lunar
>>>>>>>>>>> eclipse because Black Rock Intelligence knew that
>>>>>>>>>>> another event at the
>>>>>>>>>>> trash fence would draw the bulk of lunatics to it,
>>>>>>>>>>> rather than to the
>>>>>>>>>>> Man. In fact, one of our peripheral operatives aided
>>>>>>>>>>> in getting as
>>>>>>>>>>> many people to the fence event as possible to help
>>>>>>>>>>> BRI achieve its
>>>>>>>>>>> goal of zero injuries.
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>> Third, word went out across the playa days in
>>>>>>>>>>> advance that Black Rock
>>>>>>>>>>> Intelligence was pulling this op. This word
>>>>>>>>>>> continued to go out right
>>>>>>>>>>> up to the moment that our chief operator began the
>>>>>>>>>>> arduous climb up
>>>>>>>>>>> the guide wire. As you can all see from the results,
>>>>>>>>>>> BRI performed
>>>>>>>>>>> flawlessly in this regard.
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>> We could give a fuck less what you all think of us
>>>>>>>>>>> for doing this.
>>>>>>>>>>> Most of you are newbies who have been drawn in by
>>>>>>>>>>> the semi-religious
>>>>>>>>>>> nature of the event, or maybe just the easy drugs
>>>>>>>>>>> and easier sex. You
>>>>>>>>>>> have nothing to offer the event other than your
>>>>>>>>>>> fucking money and
>>>>>>>>>>> obedience. You spend the rest of your lives in
>>>>>>>>>>> mortal fear of
>>>>>>>>>>> everything that insurance companies tell you to
>>>>>>>>>>> fear, and pretend that
>>>>>>>>>>> you're free and clear because you spend four days at
>>>>>>>>>>> a desert
>>>>>>>>>>> bacchanal where spinelessness is not only encouraged
>>>>>>>>>>> but genetically
>>>>>>>>>>> replicated for implementation in successive
>>>>>>>>>>> generations. In short, you
>>>>>>>>>>> are the swine of which Thompson spoke. Get over
>>>>>>>>>>> yourselves.
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>> Some of us live quite well without fear. Doing so
>>>>>>>>>>> requires the
>>>>>>>>>>> ultimate in what Burning Man used to represent:
>>>>>>>>>>> personal
>>>>>>>>>>> responsibility and individual liberty. That's all
>>>>>>>>>>> been lost in the
>>>>>>>>>>> last decade of Burning Man's history. Consider this
>>>>>>>>>>> operation a
>>>>>>>>>>> history lesson that was desperately needed.
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>> One final note: Black Rock Intelligence has been
>>>>>>>>>>> permanently
>>>>>>>>>>> disbanded. All other operatives have made the
>>>>>>>>>>> ultimate sacrifice by
>>>>>>>>>>> swallowing their L-pills to avoid being captured
>>>>>>>>>>> alive. I am the sole
>>>>>>>>>>> surviving member of BRI and ask that you respect my
>>>>>>>>>>> mourning period
>>>>>>>>>>> for those who gave their lives so that this
>>>>>>>>>>> operation was a complete
>>>>>>>>>>> success.
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>> Paul D. Addis
>>>>>>>>>>> Fernley, NV

doing something they're not and pretend like they're doing everyone else a
favor by throwing a party that I dislike.

> >>>>>>>>>> From: Eric Spire <ericspire@yahoo.com>
> >>>>>>>>>> To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
> >>>>>>>>>> Subject: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy
> Capitalists
> >>>>>>>>>> Date: Thu, 30 Aug 2007 14:07:11 -0700 (PDT)
> >>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>> That message was so DEAD ON. The only thing I would
> >>>>>>>>>> add is a definition of what the writer does not
> >>>>>>>>>> address exactly....
> >>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>> It's a phrase I made up when the dead heads lost their
> >>>>>>>>>> parking lot and shows and started ruining the rave
> >>>>>>>>>> scene.
> >>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>> HIPPY CAPITALISM
> >>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>> DEFINED AS: Capitalists using hippy idealism for the
> >>>>>>>>>> purpose of seperating the idealists from their money
> >>>>>>>>>> via a mock-display of those same ideals. The HC
> >>>>>>>>>> usually takes on the appearance of the group they are
> >>>>>>>>>> extorting. The HC knows the lingo, mind-set, and
> >>>>>>>>>> culture of the sub-group they are targetting, and to
> >>>>>>>>>> many, appear to be a bullwark of the cause. Many HC's
> >>>>>>>>>> have narcicistic tendancies, and fancy the idea that
> >>>>>>>>>> they are leader of the group, a revered contributor,
> >>>>>>>>>> and in many cases, also think of themselves as
> >>>>>>>>>> artistic leaders.
> >>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>> Thats it.
> >>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>> E
> >>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>> Having read your various comments, a few things
> >>>>>>>>>>> should be addressed.
> >>>>>>>>>>> First, this operation was extensively planned well
> >>>>>>>>>>> in advance, and the
> >>>>>>>>>>> number one thing to Black Rock Intelligence was that
> >>>>>>>>>>> NO ONE be hurt.
> >>>>>>>>>>> If you people actually knew us, you'd know that we
> >>>>>>>>>>> have an extensive
> >>>>>>>>>>> background in doing things exactly like this. In
> >>>>>>>>>>> fact, we were on the
> >>>>>>>>>>> ground for some thirty minutes before ascent,
> >>>>>>>>>>> scoping the scene and
> >>>>>>>>>>> clearing people in order to minimize any possiblity
> >>>>>>>>>>> of injury to
> >>>>>>>>>>> others. We were aided by several people who were
> >>>>>>>>>>> recruited on the
> >>>>>>>>>>> playa the night of this burn (BRI has no idea who
> >>>>>>>>>>> they are, so don't
> >>>>>>>>>>> bother asking).
> >>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>> Second, the operation was planned in conjunction
> >>>>>>>>>>> with the lunar
> >>>>>>>>>>> eclipse because Black Rock Intelligence knew that
> >>>>>>>>>>> another event at the
> >>>>>>>>>>> trash fence would draw the bulk of lunatics to it,
> >>>>>>>>>>> rather than to the
> >>>>>>>>>>> Man. In fact, one of our peripheral operatives aided
> >>>>>>>>>>> in getting as
> >>>>>>>>>>> many people to the fence event as possible to help
> >>>>>>>>>>> BRI achieve its
> >>>>>>>>>>> goal of zero injuries.
> >>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>> Third, word went out across the playa days in
> >>>>>>>>>>> advance that Black Rock
> >>>>>>>>>>> Intelligence was pulling this op. This word
> >>>>>>>>>>> continued to go out right
> >>>>>>>>>>> up to the moment that our chief operator began the
> >>>>>>>>>>> arduous climb up
> >>>>>>>>>>> the guide wire. As you can all see from the results,
> >>>>>>>>>>> BRI performed
> >>>>>>>>>>> flawlessly in this regard.
> >>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>> We could give a fuck less what you all think of us
> >>>>>>>>>>> for doing this.
> >>>>>>>>>>> Most of you are newbies who have been drawn in by
> >>>>>>>>>>> the semi-religious
> >>>>>>>>>>> nature of the event, or maybe just the easy drugs
> >>>>>>>>>>> and easier sex. You
> >>>>>>>>>>> have nothing to offer the event other than your
> >>>>>>>>>>> fucking money and
> >>>>>>>>>>> obedience. You spend the rest of your lives in
> >>>>>>>>>>> mortal fear of
> >>>>>>>>>>> everything that insurance companies tell you to
> >>>>>>>>>>> fear, and pretend that
> >>>>>>>>>>> you're free and clear because you spend four days at
> >>>>>>>>>>> a desert
> >>>>>>>>>>> bacchanal where spinelessness is not only encouraged
> >>>>>>>>>>> but genetically
> >>>>>>>>>>> replicated for implementation in successive
> >>>>>>>>>>> generations. In short, you
> >>>>>>>>>>> are the swine of which Thompson spoke. Get over
> >>>>>>>>>>> yourselves.
> >>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>> Some of us live quite well without fear. Doing so
> >>>>>>>>>>> requires the
> >>>>>>>>>>> ultimate in what Burning Man used to represent:
> >>>>>>>>>>> personal
> >>>>>>>>>>> responsibility and individual liberty. That's all
> >>>>>>>>>>> been lost in the
> >>>>>>>>>>> last decade of Burning Man's history. Consider this
> >>>>>>>>>>> operation a
> >>>>>>>>>>> history lesson that was desperately needed.
> >>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>> One final note: Black Rock Intelligence has been
> >>>>>>>>>>> permanently
> >>>>>>>>>>> disbanded. All other operatives have made the
> >>>>>>>>>>> ultimate sacrifice by
> >>>>>>>>>>> swallowing their L-pills to avoid being captured
> >>>>>>>>>>> alive. I am the sole
> >>>>>>>>>>> surviving member of BRI and ask that you respect my
> >>>>>>>>>>> mourning period
> >>>>>>>>>>> for those who gave their lives so that this
> >>>>>>>>>>> operation was a complete
> >>>>>>>>>>> success.
> >>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>> Paul D. Addis
> >>>>>>>>>>> Fernley, NV
> >>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>(back when it was still a worthwhile [though still wasteful] endeavor
>>>in
>>>>>my
>>>>>>estimation) and I've met, partied with, discussed politics with many a
>>>>>>burner and I think I have a pretty good idea of what they're about.
>>>>>Which is
>>>>>>to say, creating a playground for the silicon valley tech heads to use
>>>>>for a
>>>>>>week of decompression once a year. It has nothing to do with
>>>community,
>>>>>and
>>>>>>at 350 bucks a ticket (or whatever outrageous sum they're charging
>>>this
>>>>>>year), you can rest assured that profit is a motive hiding behind many
>>>>>of
>>>>>>the organizers claims of 'community' and 'organizing.'
>>>>>>
>>>>>>I think that about sums it up. A lot of my complaints about burning
>>>man
>>>>>>would be alleviated if it were a 'anyone who wants to show up and
>>>>>contribute
>>>>>>can' type of thing instead of a 'give us all your money at the door,
>>>>>>motherfucker' type thing.
>>>>>>
>>>>>>Seen?
>>>>>>
>>>>>>
>>>>>>On 8/30/07, Dan Haskovec <dan@pry.com> wrote:
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>What outdoor party isn't wasteful by your definition? "Green Man" is
>>>>>the
>>>>>>>theme for this year, but other than "leave no trace", BM has never
>>>>>claimed
>>>>>>>to be especially environmentally friendly.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>Have you ever been? If not, your "seems to be populated" statement is
>>>>>>>meaningless. Maybe it's a generational thing, I assume you're in your
>>>>>>>early 20s and a lot of people attend who are older?
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>STDs, ha ha.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>On Thu, 30 Aug 2007, pinkko wrote:
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>I think it has something to do with a hugely wasteful party being
>>>>>thrown
>>>>>>>in
>>>>>>>>the middle of the desert by people who love to claim that they're
>>>>>>>>environmentally friendly. My main gripe is that it seems to be
>>>>>populated
>>>>>>>>mostly with a particularly virulent mixture of hippie and yuppie
>>>that
>>>>>is
>>>>>>>far
>>>>>>>>more obnoxious than just a plain hippie or a plain yuppie.
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>Also, the STDs.
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>On 8/30/07, Dan Haskovec <dan@pry.com> wrote:
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>Why so much schadenfreude over people having some fun in the
>>>desert?
>>>>>I
>>>>>>>>>really don't get it. What is it about bm attendees that pushes
>>>>>>>>>non-attendees' buttons so much?
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>On Thu, 30 Aug 2007, Van Mundegaarde wrote:
>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>I can't wait to see how pissed off all the Burners will be when
>>>they
>>>>>>>>>come
>>>>>>>>>>back from BRC and see all these threads...
