>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>From: Eric Spire <ericspire@yahoo.com>
>>>>>>>>>>>To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
>>>>>>>>>>>Subject: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy Capitalists
>>>>>>>>>>>Date: Thu, 30 Aug 2007 14:07:11 -0700 (PDT)
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>That message was so DEAD ON. The only thing I would
>>>>>>>>>>>add is a definition of what the writer does not
>>>>>>>>>>>address exactly....
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>It's a phrase I made up when the dead heads lost their
>>>>>>>>>>>parking lot and shows and started ruining the rave
>>>>>>>>>>>scene.
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>HIPPY CAPITALISM
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>DEFINED AS: Capitalists using hippy idealism for the
>>>>>>>>>>>purpose of seperating the idealists from their money
>>>>>>>>>>>via a mock-display of those same ideals. The HC
>>>>>>>>>>>usually takes on the appearance of the group they are
>>>>>>>>>>>extorting. The HC knows the lingo, mind-set, and
>>>>>>>>>>>culture of the sub-group they are targetting, and to
>>>>>>>>>>>many, appear to be a bullwark of the cause. Many HC's
>>>>>>>>>>>have narcicistic tendancies, and fancy the idea that
>>>>>>>>>>>they are leader of the group, a revered contributor,
>>>>>>>>>>>and in many cases, also think of themselves as
>>>>>>>>>>>artistic leaders.
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>Thats it.
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>E
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>Having read your various comments, a few things
>>>>>>>>>>>>should be addressed.
>>>>>>>>>>>>First, this operation was extensively planned well
>>>>>>>>>>>>in advance, and the
>>>>>>>>>>>>number one thing to Black Rock Intelligence was that
>>>>>>>>>>>>NO ONE be hurt.
>>>>>>>>>>>>If you people actually knew us, you'd know that we
>>>>>>>>>>>>have an extensive
>>>>>>>>>>>>background in doing things exactly like this. In
>>>>>>>>>>>>fact, we were on the
>>>>>>>>>>>>ground for some thirty minutes before ascent,
>>>>>>>>>>>>scoping the scene and
>>>>>>>>>>>>clearing people in order to minimize any possiblity
>>>>>>>>>>>>of injury to
>>>>>>>>>>>>others. We were aided by several people who were
>>>>>>>>>>>>recruited on the
>>>>>>>>>>>>playa the night of this burn (BRI has no idea who
>>>>>>>>>>>>they are, so don't
>>>>>>>>>>>>bother asking).
>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>Second, the operation was planned in conjunction
>>>>>>>>>>>>with the lunar
>>>>>>>>>>>>eclipse because Black Rock Intelligence knew that
>>>>>>>>>>>>another event at the
>>>>>>>>>>>>trash fence would draw the bulk of lunatics to it,
>>>>>>>>>>>>rather than to the
>>>>>>>>>>>>Man. In fact, one of our peripheral operatives aided
>>>>>>>>>>>>in getting as
>>>>>>>>>>>>many people to the fence event as possible to help
>>>>>>>>>>>>BRI achieve its
>>>>>>>>>>>>goal of zero injuries.
>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>Third, word went out across the playa days in
>>>>>>>>>>>>advance that Black Rock
>>>>>>>>>>>>Intelligence was pulling this op. This word
>>>>>>>>>>>>continued to go out right
>>>>>>>>>>>>up to the moment that our chief operator began the
>>>>>>>>>>>>arduous climb up
>>>>>>>>>>>>the guide wire. As you can all see from the results,
>>>>>>>>>>>>BRI performed
>>>>>>>>>>>>flawlessly in this regard.
>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>We could give a fuck less what you all think of us
>>>>>>>>>>>>for doing this.
>>>>>>>>>>>>Most of you are newbies who have been drawn in by
>>>>>>>>>>>>the semi-religious
>>>>>>>>>>>>nature of the event, or maybe just the easy drugs
>>>>>>>>>>>>and easier sex. You
>>>>>>>>>>>>have nothing to offer the event other than your
>>>>>>>>>>>>fucking money and
>>>>>>>>>>>>obedience. You spend the rest of your lives in
>>>>>>>>>>>>mortal fear of
>>>>>>>>>>>>everything that insurance companies tell you to
>>>>>>>>>>>>fear, and pretend that
>>>>>>>>>>>>you're free and clear because you spend four days at
>>>>>>>>>>>>a desert
>>>>>>>>>>>>bacchanal where spinelessness is not only encouraged
>>>>>>>>>>>>but genetically
>>>>>>>>>>>>replicated for implementation in successive
>>>>>>>>>>>>generations. In short, you
>>>>>>>>>>>>are the swine of which Thompson spoke. Get over
>>>>>>>>>>>>yourselves.
>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>Some of us live quite well without fear. Doing so
>>>>>>>>>>>>requires the
>>>>>>>>>>>>ultimate in what Burning Man used to represent:
>>>>>>>>>>>>personal
>>>>>>>>>>>>responsibility and individual liberty. That's all
>>>>>>>>>>>>been lost in the
>>>>>>>>>>>>last decade of Burning Man's history. Consider this
>>>>>>>>>>>>operation a
>>>>>>>>>>>>history lesson that was desperately needed.
>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>One final note: Black Rock Intelligence has been
>>>>>>>>>>>>permanently
>>>>>>>>>>>>disbanded. All other operatives have made the
>>>>>>>>>>>>ultimate sacrifice by
>>>>>>>>>>>>swallowing their L-pills to avoid being captured
>>>>>>>>>>>>alive. I am the sole
>>>>>>>>>>>>surviving member of BRI and ask that you respect my
>>>>>>>>>>>>mourning period
>>>>>>>>>>>>for those who gave their lives so that this
>>>>>>>>>>>>operation was a complete
>>>>>>>>>>>>success.
>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>Paul D. Addis
>>>>>>>>>>>>Fernley, NV
>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>On 8/30/07, dangrsmind@yahoo.com
>>>>>>>>>>>><dangrsmind@yahoo.com> wrote:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>Some great discussion of the early burning of the
>>>>>>>>>>>>man etc. at laughing squid.  Some quasi-intelligent
>>>>>>>>>>>>comments too, so read the whole thing if you are
>>>>>>>>>>>>interested in art and counterculture.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>
>>>http://laughingsquid.com/burning-man-set-on-fire-early-arson-is-to-blame
>>>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>

> >>On 8/30/07, Dan Haskovec <dan@pry.com> wrote:
> >>>
> >>>Ah, so it's not the consumption you're concerned with, it's that you
> >>>disapprove on aesthetic grounds! Again, I can't argue that.
> >>>
> >>>There is no flora or fauna on the playa, it's a seasonally dry alkaline
> >>>lakebed. Think drywall dust. That's the whole point of holding the
> event
> >>>there. Here's a fine illustration of the location:
> >>>
> >>>
> >>>
> http://pic.templetons.com/cgi-bin/imget?d=brad/photo/bm06/plane&fn=img_7927.jpg
> >>>
> >>>The BLM sets very strict usage requirements, they don't even allow
> fires
> >>>directly on the ground anymore because it bakes the clay and is too
> >>>difficult to restore. Most of the art cars are pretty darn efficient,
> >>>ours
> >>>was based on an old Volvo station wagon and could transport 20 people.
> >>>Cargo trucks are more efficient than hauling the same amount of weight
> in
> >>>passenger cars.
> >>>
> >>>If you want to get technical, air travel is much more environmentally
> >>>destructive than driving several hundred miles for a week's vacation.
> >>>People flying to Costa Rica on eco-vacations burn a lot more fuel than
> >>>people driving to Nevada. It's pointless to argue that one is somehow
> >>>more
> >>>worthwhile than the other if you're not the person making the decision
> to
> >>>partake.
> >>>
> >>>
> >>>On Thu, 30 Aug 2007, pinkko wrote:
> >>>
> >>>>I didn't say all recreational travel is to be condemned, just that I
> >>>find it
> >>>>obnoxious that people who will scream about 'leave no trace' will then
> >>>get
> >>>>into their horribly inefficient vehicles to go romp around in the
> >>>wilderness
> >>>>and create havoc for god only knows how much wildlife. Not to mention
> >>>the
> >>>>global warming concerns.
> >>>>
> >>>>I mean, if you want to throw a huge ass wasteful party in the desert,
> >>>feel
> >>>>free, I'm not going to try and stop it, but don't go around couching
> >>>>yourself in environmental values when you in reality have no such
> >>>values. Or
> >>>>certainly not values strong enough to prevent you from going on a
> >>>hedonistic
> >>>>adventure through a desert that would be much better off without your
> >>>>presence there.
> >>>>
> >>>>Like I said I tend to avoid outdoor parties to begin with. I think we
> >>>have
> >>>>more than enough unused, wasted space in our cities now that could be
> >>>used
> >>>>to throw much better parties than burning man that don't require the
> >>>>movement of tens of thousands of people into usually pristine
> wilderness
> >>>at
> >>>>the cost of millions of gallons of gasoline and untold numbers of

> >>>>>>>>>>>>rather than to the
> >>>>>>>>>>>>Man. In fact, one of our peripheral operatives aided
> >>>>>>>>>>>>in getting as
> >>>>>>>>>>>>many people to the fence event as possible to help
> >>>>>>>>>>>>BRI achieve its
> >>>>>>>>>>>>goal of zero injuries.
> >>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>Third, word went out across the playa days in
> >>>>>>>>>>>>advance that Black Rock
> >>>>>>>>>>>>Intelligence was pulling this op. This word
> >>>>>>>>>>>>continued to go out right
> >>>>>>>>>>>>up to the moment that our chief operator began the
> >>>>>>>>>>>>arduous climb up
> >>>>>>>>>>>>the guide wire. As you can all see from the results,
> >>>>>>>>>>>>BRI performed
> >>>>>>>>>>>>flawlessly in this regard.
> >>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>We could give a fuck less what you all think of us
> >>>>>>>>>>>>for doing this.
> >>>>>>>>>>>>Most of you are newbies who have been drawn in by
> >>>>>>>>>>>>the semi-religious
> >>>>>>>>>>>>nature of the event, or maybe just the easy drugs
> >>>>>>>>>>>>and easier sex. You
> >>>>>>>>>>>>have nothing to offer the event other than your
> >>>>>>>>>>>>fucking money and
> >>>>>>>>>>>>obedience. You spend the rest of your lives in
> >>>>>>>>>>>>mortal fear of
> >>>>>>>>>>>>everything that insurance companies tell you to
> >>>>>>>>>>>>fear, and pretend that
> >>>>>>>>>>>>you're free and clear because you spend four days at
> >>>>>>>>>>>>a desert
> >>>>>>>>>>>>bacchanal where spinelessness is not only encouraged
> >>>>>>>>>>>>but genetically
> >>>>>>>>>>>>replicated for implementation in successive
> >>>>>>>>>>>>generations. In short, you
> >>>>>>>>>>>>are the swine of which Thompson spoke. Get over
> >>>>>>>>>>>>yourselves.
> >>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>Some of us live quite well without fear. Doing so
> >>>>>>>>>>>>requires the
> >>>>>>>>>>>>ultimate in what Burning Man used to represent:
> >>>>>>>>>>>>personal
> >>>>>>>>>>>>responsibility and individual liberty. That's all
> >>>>>>>>>>>>been lost in the
> >>>>>>>>>>>>last decade of Burning Man's history. Consider this
> >>>>>>>>>>>>operation a
> >>>>>>>>>>>>history lesson that was desperately needed.
> >>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>One final note: Black Rock Intelligence has been
> >>>>>>>>>>>>permanently
> >>>>>>>>>>>>disbanded. All other operatives have made the
> >>>>>>>>>>>>ultimate sacrifice by
> >>>>>>>>>>>>swallowing their L-pills to avoid being captured
> >>>>>>>>>>>>alive. I am the sole
> >>>>>>>>>>>>surviving member of BRI and ask that you respect my
> >>>>>>>>>>>>mourning period
> >>>>>>>>>>>>for those who gave their lives so that this
> >>>>>>>>>>>>operation was a complete
> >>>>>>>>>>>>success.
> >>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>Paul D. Addis
> >>>>>>>>>>>>Fernley, NV
> >>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>

> > >>>>>>>>>>>address exactly....
> > >>>>>>>>>>>
> > >>>>>>>>>>>It's a phrase I made up when the dead heads lost their
> > >>>>>>>>>>>parking lot and shows and started ruining the rave
> > >>>>>>>>>>>scene.
> > >>>>>>>>>>>
> > >>>>>>>>>>>HIPPY CAPITALISM
> > >>>>>>>>>>>
> > >>>>>>>>>>>DEFINED AS: Capitalists using hippy idealism for the
> > >>>>>>>>>>>purpose of seperating the idealists from their money
> > >>>>>>>>>>>via a mock-display of those same ideals. The HC
> > >>>>>>>>>>>usually takes on the appearance of the group they are
> > >>>>>>>>>>>extorting. The HC knows the lingo, mind-set, and
> > >>>>>>>>>>>culture of the sub-group they are targetting, and to
> > >>>>>>>>>>>many, appear to be a bullwark of the cause. Many HC's
> > >>>>>>>>>>>have narcicistic tendancies, and fancy the idea that
> > >>>>>>>>>>>they are leader of the group, a revered contributor,
> > >>>>>>>>>>>and in many cases, also think of themselves as
> > >>>>>>>>>>>artistic leaders.
> > >>>>>>>>>>>
> > >>>>>>>>>>>Thats it.
> > >>>>>>>>>>>
> > >>>>>>>>>>>E
> > >>>>>>>>>>>
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>Having read your various comments, a few things
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>should be addressed.
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>First, this operation was extensively planned well
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>in advance, and the
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>number one thing to Black Rock Intelligence was that
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>NO ONE be hurt.
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>If you people actually knew us, you'd know that we
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>have an extensive
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>background in doing things exactly like this. In
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>fact, we were on the
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>ground for some thirty minutes before ascent,
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>scoping the scene and
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>clearing people in order to minimize any possiblity
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>of injury to
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>others. We were aided by several people who were
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>recruited on the
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>playa the night of this burn (BRI has no idea who
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>they are, so don't
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>bother asking).
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>Second, the operation was planned in conjunction
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>with the lunar
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>eclipse because Black Rock Intelligence knew that
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>another event at the
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>trash fence would draw the bulk of lunatics to it,
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>rather than to the
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>Man. In fact, one of our peripheral operatives aided
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>in getting as
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>many people to the fence event as possible to help
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>BRI achieve its
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>goal of zero injuries.
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>Third, word went out across the playa days in
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>advance that Black Rock
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>Intelligence was pulling this op. This word
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>continued to go out right
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>up to the moment that our chief operator began the
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>arduous climb up
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>the guide wire. As you can all see from the results,
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>BRI performed
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>flawlessly in this regard.
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>We could give a fuck less what you all think of us
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>for doing this.
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>Most of you are newbies who have been drawn in by
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>the semi-religious
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>nature of the event, or maybe just the easy drugs
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>and easier sex. You
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>have nothing to offer the event other than your
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>fucking money and
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>obedience. You spend the rest of your lives in
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>mortal fear of
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>everything that insurance companies tell you to
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>fear, and pretend that
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>you're free and clear because you spend four days at
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>a desert
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>bacchanal where spinelessness is not only encouraged
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>but genetically
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>replicated for implementation in successive
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>generations. In short, you
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>are the swine of which Thompson spoke. Get over
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>yourselves.
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>Some of us live quite well without fear. Doing so
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>requires the
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>ultimate in what Burning Man used to represent:
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>personal
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>responsibility and individual liberty. That's all
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>been lost in the
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>last decade of Burning Man's history. Consider this
> > >>>>>>>>>>>>operation a

music, and a spectacular natural setting, among other things. I don't know

>>> On 8/30/07, Dan Haskovec <dan@pry.com> wrote:
>>>> 
>>>> Ah, so it's not the consumption you're concerned with, it's that you
>>>> disapprove on aesthetic grounds! Again, I can't argue that.
>>>> 
>>>> There is no flora or fauna on the playa, it's a seasonally dry alkaline
>>>> lakebed. Think drywall dust. That's the whole point of holding the event
>>>> there. Here's a fine illustration of the location:
>>>> 
>>>> 
>>>> http://pic.templetons.com/cgi-bin/imget?d=brad/photo/bm06/plane&fn=img_7927.jpg
>>>> 
>>>> The BLM sets very strict usage requirements, they don't even allow fires
>>>> directly on the ground anymore because it bakes the clay and is too
>>>> difficult to restore. Most of the art cars are pretty darn efficient, 
>>>> ours
>>>> was based on an old Volvo station wagon and could transport 20 people.
>>>> Cargo trucks are more efficient than hauling the same amount of weight in
>>>> passenger cars.
>>>> 
>>>> If you want to get technical, air travel is much more environmentally
>>>> destructive than driving several hundred miles for a week's vacation.
>>>> People flying to Costa Rica on eco-vacations burn a lot more fuel than
>>>> people driving to Nevada. It's pointless to argue that one is somehow 
>>>> more
>>>> worthwhile than the other if you're not the person making the decision to
>>>> partake.
>>>> 
>>>> 
>>>> On Thu, 30 Aug 2007, pinkko wrote:
>>>> 
>>>>> I didn't say all recreational travel is to be condemned, just that I
>>>> find it
>>>>> obnoxious that people who will scream about 'leave no trace' will then
>>>> get
>>>>> into their horribly inefficient vehicles to go romp around in the
>>>> wilderness
>>>>> and create havoc for god only knows how much wildlife. Not to mention
>>>> the
>>>>> global warming concerns.
>>>>> 
>>>>> I mean, if you want to throw a huge ass wasteful party in the desert,

>>>>> free, I'm not going to try and stop it, but don't go around couching
>>>>> yourself in environmental values when you in reality have no such
>>>> values. Or
>>>>> certainly not values strong enough to prevent you from going on a
>>>> hedonistic
>>>>> adventure through a desert that would be much better off without your
>>>>> presence there.
>>>>> 
>>>>> Like I said I tend to avoid outdoor parties to begin with. I think we
>>>> have
>>>>> more than enough unused, wasted space in our cities now that could be
>>>> used
>>>>> to throw much better parties than burning man that don't require the
>>>>> movement of tens of thousands of people into usually pristine wilderness

>>>>> the cost of millions of gallons of gasoline and untold numbers of other

>>>>>> 
>>>>>> My one personal story relating to your "ticket ripoff" scenario: In
>>>> '99,
>>>>>> we picked up a kid in Reno who was hitching a ride to the playa. He had
>>>>>> come up from Dallas by bus with just a big backpack. He bought a ticket
>>>> at
>>>>>> the door, wound up volunteering at the center camp cafe, and they
>>>> refunded
>>>>>> him the money for the ticket. He ended up camping with our group for
>>>> the
>>>>>> week (30 people that year, 20' truck and all - big hassle, we dropped
>>>> the
>>>>>> group and the truck for future years). Maybe this doesn't happen
>>>> anymore
>>>>>> though, and had it occurred in 2007, he would have given us all

>>>>>>>>>>>> From: Eric Spire <ericspire@yahoo.com>
>>>>>>>>>>>> To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
>>>>>>>>>>>> Subject: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy Capitalists
>>>>>>>>>>>> Date: Thu, 30 Aug 2007 14:07:11 -0700 (PDT)
>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>> That message was so DEAD ON. The only thing I would
>>>>>>>>>>>> add is a definition of what the writer does not
>>>>>>>>>>>> address exactly....
>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>> It's a phrase I made up when the dead heads lost their
>>>>>>>>>>>> parking lot and shows and started ruining the rave
>>>>>>>>>>>> scene.
>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>> HIPPY CAPITALISM
>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>> DEFINED AS: Capitalists using hippy idealism for the
>>>>>>>>>>>> purpose of seperating the idealists from their money
>>>>>>>>>>>> via a mock-display of those same ideals. The HC
>>>>>>>>>>>> usually takes on the appearance of the group they are
>>>>>>>>>>>> extorting. The HC knows the lingo, mind-set, and
>>>>>>>>>>>> culture of the sub-group they are targetting, and to
>>>>>>>>>>>> many, appear to be a bullwark of the cause. Many HC's
>>>>>>>>>>>> have narcicistic tendancies, and fancy the idea that
>>>>>>>>>>>> they are leader of the group, a revered contributor,
>>>>>>>>>>>> and in many cases, also think of themselves as
>>>>>>>>>>>> artistic leaders.
>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>> Thats it.
>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>> E
>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>> Having read your various comments, a few things
>>>>>>>>>>>>> should be addressed.
>>>>>>>>>>>>> First, this operation was extensively planned well
>>>>>>>>>>>>> in advance, and the
>>>>>>>>>>>>> number one thing to Black Rock Intelligence was that
>>>>>>>>>>>>> NO ONE be hurt.
>>>>>>>>>>>>> If you people actually knew us, you'd know that we
>>>>>>>>>>>>> have an extensive
>>>>>>>>>>>>> background in doing things exactly like this. In
>>>>>>>>>>>>> fact, we were on the
>>>>>>>>>>>>> ground for some thirty minutes before ascent,
>>>>>>>>>>>>> scoping the scene and
>>>>>>>>>>>>> clearing people in order to minimize any possiblity
>>>>>>>>>>>>> of injury to
>>>>>>>>>>>>> others. We were aided by several people who were
>>>>>>>>>>>>> recruited on the
>>>>>>>>>>>>> playa the night of this burn (BRI has no idea who
>>>>>>>>>>>>> they are, so don't
>>>>>>>>>>>>> bother asking).
>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>> Second, the operation was planned in conjunction
>>>>>>>>>>>>> with the lunar
>>>>>>>>>>>>> eclipse because Black Rock Intelligence knew that
>>>>>>>>>>>>> another event at the
>>>>>>>>>>>>> trash fence would draw the bulk of lunatics to it,
>>>>>>>>>>>>> rather than to the
>>>>>>>>>>>>> Man. In fact, one of our peripheral operatives aided
>>>>>>>>>>>>> in getting as
>>>>>>>>>>>>> many people to the fence event as possible to help
>>>>>>>>>>>>> BRI achieve its
>>>>>>>>>>>>> goal of zero injuries.
>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>> Third, word went out across the playa days in
>>>>>>>>>>>>> advance that Black Rock
>>>>>>>>>>>>> Intelligence was pulling this op. This word
>>>>>>>>>>>>> continued to go out right
>>>>>>>>>>>>> up to the moment that our chief operator began the
>>>>>>>>>>>>> arduous climb up
>>>>>>>>>>>>> the guide wire. As you can all see from the results,
>>>>>>>>>>>>> BRI performed
>>>>>>>>>>>>> flawlessly in this regard.
>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>> We could give a fuck less what you all think of us
>>>>>>>>>>>>> for doing this.
>>>>>>>>>>>>> Most of you are newbies who have been drawn in by
>>>>>>>>>>>>> the semi-religious
>>>>>>>>>>>>> nature of the event, or maybe just the easy drugs
>>>>>>>>>>>>> and easier sex. You
>>>>>>>>>>>>> have nothing to offer the event other than your
>>>>>>>>>>>>> fucking money and
>>>>>>>>>>>>> obedience. You spend the rest of your lives in
>>>>>>>>>>>>> mortal fear of
>>>>>>>>>>>>> everything that insurance companies tell you to
>>>>>>>>>>>>> fear, and pretend that
>>>>>>>>>>>>> you're free and clear because you spend four days at
>>>>>>>>>>>>> a desert
>>>>>>>>>>>>> bacchanal where spinelessness is not only encouraged
>>>>>>>>>>>>> but genetically
>>>>>>>>>>>>> replicated for implementation in successive
>>>>>>>>>>>>> generations. In short, you
>>>>>>>>>>>>> are the swine of which Thompson spoke. Get over
>>>>>>>>>>>>> yourselves.
>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>> Some of us live quite well without fear. Doing so
>>>>>>>>>>>>> requires the
>>>>>>>>>>>>> ultimate in what Burning Man used to represent:
>>>>>>>>>>>>> personal
>>>>>>>>>>>>> responsibility and individual liberty. That's all
>>>>>>>>>>>>> been lost in the
>>>>>>>>>>>>> last decade of Burning Man's history. Consider this
>>>>>>>>>>>>> operation a
>>>>>>>>>>>>> history lesson that was desperately needed.
>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>> One final note: Black Rock Intelligence has been
>>>>>>>>>>>>> permanently
>>>>>>>>>>>>> disbanded. All other operatives have made the
>>>>>>>>>>>>> ultimate sacrifice by
>>>>>>>>>>>>> swallowing their L-pills to avoid being captured
>>>>>>>>>>>>> alive. I am the sole
>>>>>>>>>>>>> surviving member of BRI and ask that you respect my
>>>>>>>>>>>>> mourning period
>>>>>>>>>>>>> for those who gave their lives so that this
>>>>>>>>>>>>> operation was a complete
>>>>>>>>>>>>> success.
>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>> Paul D. Addis
>>>>>>>>>>>>> Fernley, NV
>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>ours
>>>>>was based on an old Volvo station wagon and could transport 20 people.
>>>>>Cargo trucks are more efficient than hauling the same amount of weight 
>>>>>in
>>>>>passenger cars.

>>>>>destructive than driving several hundred miles for a week's vacation.

>>>>>people driving to Nevada. It's pointless to argue that one is somehow 
>>>>>more

>>>>>>>>>>>>>From: Eric Spire <ericspire@yahoo.com>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
>>>>>>>>>>>>>Subject: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>Capitalists
>>>>>>>>>>>>>Date: Thu, 30 Aug 2007 14:07:11 -0700 (PDT)
>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>That message was so DEAD ON. The only thing I would
>>>>>>>>>>>>>add is a definition of what the writer does not
>>>>>>>>>>>>>address exactly....
>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>It's a phrase I made up when the dead heads lost their
>>>>>>>>>>>>>parking lot and shows and started ruining the rave
>>>>>>>>>>>>>scene.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>HIPPY CAPITALISM
>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>DEFINED AS: Capitalists using hippy idealism for the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>purpose of seperating the idealists from their money
>>>>>>>>>>>>>via a mock-display of those same ideals. The HC
>>>>>>>>>>>>>usually takes on the appearance of the group they are
>>>>>>>>>>>>>extorting. The HC knows the lingo, mind-set, and
>>>>>>>>>>>>>culture of the sub-group they are targetting, and to
>>>>>>>>>>>>>many, appear to be a bullwark of the cause. Many HC's
>>>>>>>>>>>>>have narcicistic tendancies, and fancy the idea that
>>>>>>>>>>>>>they are leader of the group, a revered contributor,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>and in many cases, also think of themselves as
>>>>>>>>>>>>>artistic leaders.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>Thats it.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>E
>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Having read your various comments, a few things
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>should be addressed.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>First, this operation was extensively planned well
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>in advance, and the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>number one thing to Black Rock Intelligence was that
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>NO ONE be hurt.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>If you people actually knew us, you'd know that we
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>have an extensive
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>background in doing things exactly like this. In
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>fact, we were on the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>ground for some thirty minutes before ascent,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>scoping the scene and
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>clearing people in order to minimize any possiblity
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>of injury to
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>others. We were aided by several people who were
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>recruited on the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>playa the night of this burn (BRI has no idea who
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>they are, so don't
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>bother asking).
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Second, the operation was planned in conjunction
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>with the lunar
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>eclipse because Black Rock Intelligence knew that
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>another event at the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>trash fence would draw the bulk of lunatics to it,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>rather than to the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Man. In fact, one of our peripheral operatives aided
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>in getting as
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>many people to the fence event as possible to help
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>BRI achieve its
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>goal of zero injuries.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Third, word went out across the playa days in
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>advance that Black Rock
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Intelligence was pulling this op. This word
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>continued to go out right
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>up to the moment that our chief operator began the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>arduous climb up
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>the guide wire. As you can all see from the results,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>BRI performed
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>flawlessly in this regard.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>We could give a fuck less what you all think of us
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>for doing this.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Most of you are newbies who have been drawn in by
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>the semi-religious
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>nature of the event, or maybe just the easy drugs
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>and easier sex. You
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>have nothing to offer the event other than your
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>fucking money and
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>obedience. You spend the rest of your lives in
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>mortal fear of
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>everything that insurance companies tell you to
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>fear, and pretend that
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>you're free and clear because you spend four days at
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>a desert
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>bacchanal where spinelessness is not only encouraged
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>but genetically
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>replicated for implementation in successive
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>generations. In short, you
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>are the swine of which Thompson spoke. Get over
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>yourselves.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Some of us live quite well without fear. Doing so
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>requires the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>ultimate in what Burning Man used to represent:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>personal
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>responsibility and individual liberty. That's all
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>been lost in the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>last decade of Burning Man's history. Consider this
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>operation a
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>history lesson that was desperately needed.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>One final note: Black Rock Intelligence has been
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>permanently
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>disbanded. All other operatives have made the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>ultimate sacrifice by
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>swallowing their L-pills to avoid being captured
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>alive. I am the sole
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>surviving member of BRI and ask that you respect my
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>mourning period
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>for those who gave their lives so that this
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>operation was a complete
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>success.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Paul D. Addis
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Fernley, NV
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>>>> emblematic of the whole attitudes of burners (or at least the 
>>>>>>>>> burners
>>>>>>>> I've
>>>>>>>>> come into contact with). They love to try to convince themselves 
>>>>>>>>> that
>>>>>>>>> they're not causing harm, yet will not hesitate to drive a vehicle
>>>>>> that
>>>>>>>> gets
>>>>>>>>> 3mpg several hundred miles into the desert to sit and get completely
>>>>>>>> wasted
>>>>>>>>> on drugs (and syphilis!) for a week.
>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>> I can't say I've ever been, but I have been aware of it since the 
>>>>>>>>> mid
>>>>>>>> 90's
>>>>>>>>> (back when it was still a worthwhile [though still wasteful] 
>>>>>>>>> endeavor
>>>>>> in
>>>>>>>> my
>>>>>>>>> estimation) and I've met, partied with, discussed politics with many 
>>>>>>>>> a
>>>>>>>>> burner and I think I have a pretty good idea of what they're about.
>>>>>>>> Which is
>>>>>>>>> to say, creating a playground for the silicon valley tech heads to 
>>>>>>>>> use
>>>>>>>> for a
>>>>>>>>> week of decompression once a year. It has nothing to do with
>>>>>> community,
>>>>>>>> and
>>>>>>>>> at 350 bucks a ticket (or whatever outrageous sum they're charging
>>>>>> this
>>>>>>>>> year), you can rest assured that profit is a motive hiding behind 
>>>>>>>>> many
>>>>>>>> of
>>>>>>>>> the organizers claims of 'community' and 'organizing.'
>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>> I think that about sums it up. A lot of my complaints about burning
>>>>>> man
>>>>>>>>> would be alleviated if it were a 'anyone who wants to show up and
>>>>>>>> contribute
>>>>>>>>> can' type of thing instead of a 'give us all your money at the door,
>>>>>>>>> motherfucker' type thing.
>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>> Seen?
>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>> On 8/30/07, Dan Haskovec <dan@pry.com> wrote:
>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>> What outdoor party isn't wasteful by your definition? "Green Man" 
>>>>>>>>>> is
>>>>>>>> the
>>>>>>>>>> theme for this year, but other than "leave no trace", BM has never
>>>>>>>> claimed
>>>>>>>>>> to be especially environmentally friendly.
>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>> Have you ever been? If not, your "seems to be populated" statement 
>>>>>>>>>> is
>>>>>>>>>> meaningless. Maybe it's a generational thing, I assume you're in 
>>>>>>>>>> your
>>>>>>>>>> early 20s and a lot of people attend who are older?
>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>> STDs, ha ha.
>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>>>>>> On 8/30/07, Dan Haskovec <dan@pry.com> wrote:
>>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>> desert?

>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> From: Eric Spire <ericspire@yahoo.com>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Subject: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Capitalists
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Date: Thu, 30 Aug 2007 14:07:11 -0700 (PDT)
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> That message was so DEAD ON. The only thing I would
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> add is a definition of what the writer does not
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> address exactly....
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> It's a phrase I made up when the dead heads lost their
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> parking lot and shows and started ruining the rave
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> scene.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> HIPPY CAPITALISM
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> DEFINED AS: Capitalists using hippy idealism for the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> purpose of seperating the idealists from their money
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> via a mock-display of those same ideals. The HC
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> usually takes on the appearance of the group they are
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> extorting. The HC knows the lingo, mind-set, and
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> culture of the sub-group they are targetting, and to
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> many, appear to be a bullwark of the cause. Many HC's
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> have narcicistic tendancies, and fancy the idea that
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> they are leader of the group, a revered contributor,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> and in many cases, also think of themselves as
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> artistic leaders.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Thats it.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> E
>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Having read your various comments, a few things
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> should be addressed.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> First, this operation was extensively planned well
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> in advance, and the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> number one thing to Black Rock Intelligence was that
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> NO ONE be hurt.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> If you people actually knew us, you'd know that we
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> have an extensive
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> background in doing things exactly like this. In
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> fact, we were on the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> ground for some thirty minutes before ascent,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> scoping the scene and
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> clearing people in order to minimize any possiblity
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> of injury to
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> others. We were aided by several people who were
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> recruited on the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> playa the night of this burn (BRI has no idea who
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> they are, so don't
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> bother asking).
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Second, the operation was planned in conjunction
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> with the lunar
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> eclipse because Black Rock Intelligence knew that
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> another event at the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> trash fence would draw the bulk of lunatics to it,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> rather than to the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Man. In fact, one of our peripheral operatives aided
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> in getting as
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> many people to the fence event as possible to help
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> BRI achieve its
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> goal of zero injuries.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Third, word went out across the playa days in
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> advance that Black Rock
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Intelligence was pulling this op. This word
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> continued to go out right
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> up to the moment that our chief operator began the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> arduous climb up
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> the guide wire. As you can all see from the results,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> BRI performed
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> flawlessly in this regard.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> We could give a fuck less what you all think of us
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> for doing this.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Most of you are newbies who have been drawn in by
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> the semi-religious
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> nature of the event, or maybe just the easy drugs
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> and easier sex. You
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> have nothing to offer the event other than your
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> fucking money and
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> obedience. You spend the rest of your lives in
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> mortal fear of
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> everything that insurance companies tell you to
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> fear, and pretend that
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> you're free and clear because you spend four days at
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> a desert
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> bacchanal where spinelessness is not only encouraged
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> but genetically
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> replicated for implementation in successive
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> generations. In short, you
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> are the swine of which Thompson spoke. Get over
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> yourselves.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Some of us live quite well without fear. Doing so
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> requires the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> ultimate in what Burning Man used to represent:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> personal
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> responsibility and individual liberty. That's all
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> been lost in the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> last decade of Burning Man's history. Consider this
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> operation a
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> history lesson that was desperately needed.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> One final note: Black Rock Intelligence has been
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> permanently
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> disbanded. All other operatives have made the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> ultimate sacrifice by
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> swallowing their L-pills to avoid being captured
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> alive. I am the sole
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> surviving member of BRI and ask that you respect my
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> mourning period
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> for those who gave their lives so that this
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> operation was a complete
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> success.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Paul D. Addis
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Fernley, NV
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

> >>>>>>>>>>I think it has something to do with a hugely wasteful party
> being
> >>>>>>>thrown
> >>>>>>>>>in
> >>>>>>>>>>the middle of the desert by people who love to claim that
> they're
> >>>>>>>>>>environmentally friendly. My main gripe is that it seems to be
> >>>>>>>populated
> >>>>>>>>>>mostly with a particularly virulent mixture of hippie and yuppie
> >>>>>that
> >>>>>>>is
> >>>>>>>>>far
> >>>>>>>>>>more obnoxious than just a plain hippie or a plain yuppie.
> >>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>Also, the STDs.
> >>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>On 8/30/07, Dan Haskovec <dan@pry.com> wrote:
> >>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>Why so much schadenfreude over people having some fun in the
> >>>>>desert?
> >>>>>>>I
> >>>>>>>>>>>really don't get it. What is it about bm attendees that pushes
> >>>>>>>>>>>non-attendees' buttons so much?
> >>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>

> >>>>>>>>>>>

> when

> >>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>From: Eric Spire <ericspire@yahoo.com>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>Subject: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>Capitalists
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>Date: Thu, 30 Aug 2007 14:07:11 -0700 (PDT)
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>That message was so DEAD ON. The only thing I would
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>add is a definition of what the writer does not
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>address exactly....
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>It's a phrase I made up when the dead heads lost their
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>parking lot and shows and started ruining the rave
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>scene.
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>HIPPY CAPITALISM
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>DEFINED AS: Capitalists using hippy idealism for the
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>purpose of seperating the idealists from their money
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>via a mock-display of those same ideals. The HC
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>usually takes on the appearance of the group they are
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>extorting. The HC knows the lingo, mind-set, and
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>culture of the sub-group they are targetting, and to
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>many, appear to be a bullwark of the cause. Many HC's
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>have narcicistic tendancies, and fancy the idea that
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>they are leader of the group, a revered contributor,
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>and in many cases, also think of themselves as
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>artistic leaders.
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>Thats it.
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>E
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>Having read your various comments, a few things
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>should be addressed.
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>First, this operation was extensively planned well
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>in advance, and the
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>number one thing to Black Rock Intelligence was that
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>NO ONE be hurt.
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>If you people actually knew us, you'd know that we
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>have an extensive
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>background in doing things exactly like this. In
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>fact, we were on the
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>ground for some thirty minutes before ascent,
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>scoping the scene and
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>clearing people in order to minimize any possiblity
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>of injury to
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>others. We were aided by several people who were
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>recruited on the
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>playa the night of this burn (BRI has no idea who
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>they are, so don't
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>bother asking).
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>Second, the operation was planned in conjunction
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>with the lunar
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>eclipse because Black Rock Intelligence knew that
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>another event at the
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>trash fence would draw the bulk of lunatics to it,
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>rather than to the
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>Man. In fact, one of our peripheral operatives aided
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>in getting as
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>many people to the fence event as possible to help
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>BRI achieve its
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>goal of zero injuries.
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>Third, word went out across the playa days in
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>advance that Black Rock
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>Intelligence was pulling this op. This word
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>continued to go out right
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>up to the moment that our chief operator began the
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>arduous climb up
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>the guide wire. As you can all see from the results,
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>BRI performed
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>flawlessly in this regard.
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>We could give a fuck less what you all think of us
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>for doing this.
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>Most of you are newbies who have been drawn in by
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>the semi-religious
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>nature of the event, or maybe just the easy drugs
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>and easier sex. You
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>have nothing to offer the event other than your
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>fucking money and
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>obedience. You spend the rest of your lives in
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>mortal fear of
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>everything that insurance companies tell you to
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>fear, and pretend that
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>you're free and clear because you spend four days at
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>a desert
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>bacchanal where spinelessness is not only encouraged
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>but genetically
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>replicated for implementation in successive
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>generations. In short, you
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>are the swine of which Thompson spoke. Get over
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>yourselves.
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>Some of us live quite well without fear. Doing so
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>requires the
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>ultimate in what Burning Man used to represent:
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>personal
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>responsibility and individual liberty. That's all
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>been lost in the
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>last decade of Burning Man's history. Consider this
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>operation a
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>history lesson that was desperately needed.
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>One final note: Black Rock Intelligence has been
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>permanently
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>disbanded. All other operatives have made the
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>ultimate sacrifice by
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>swallowing their L-pills to avoid being captured
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>alive. I am the sole
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>surviving member of BRI and ask that you respect my
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>mourning period
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>for those who gave their lives so that this
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>operation was a complete
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>success.
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>Paul D. Addis
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>Fernley, NV
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>
> >>>>>>>>>>>>>>

My contribution on another list in a flame fest with a dude that's 
defending the Burner's that had this guy arrested, for the crime of 
taking the 'think out of the box' ethos at face value, after I told him 
that he if he wanted secure, know what to expect, entertainment, he 
should go to Dinnyland, to which he gave me the 'where will the 
anarchism end?' argument and this is my reply to that:

Challenging questions, I'll have to think on 'em and I'll get back to you..

In the meantime this might help with the answers you seek:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mg-2DTLlDOM
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qDiffWitYi8
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LZPF-YOlgsI

pinkko wrote:
> Fair enough, like I said if they want to throw burning man every year I'm
> not going to stop them. It is, as you said essentially a matter of taste
> (both social and environmental, I don't like hippie types, or yuppie types,
> nor do I like the idea of being out in the middle of nowhere for a week). I
> do think, however, that a bunch of people getting together to get fucked up
> in the middle of nowhere for a week ought to at least be honest about it and
> say that's what they're doing. Instead of claiming to be all forward
> thinking and community minded. Which of humanities problems has burning man
> ever solved? Or even begun to consider how to solve? It's a fucking party,
> get over it.
>
> You're not artists, you're asshats with nothing better to do.
>
> This guy's got the ride idea:
> http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/blogs/sfgate/detail?blogid=3&entry_id=19890
>
> If only they'd go Jonestown, the world would be such a better place.

> On 8/30/07, Dan Haskovec <dan@pry.com> wrote:
>   
>> Ah, so it's not the consumption you're concerned with, it's that you
>> disapprove on aesthetic grounds! Again, I can't argue that.
>>
>> There is no flora or fauna on the playa, it's a seasonally dry alkaline
>> lakebed. Think drywall dust. That's the whole point of holding the event
>> there. Here's a fine illustration of the location:
>>
>>
>> http://pic.templetons.com/cgi-bin/imget?d=brad/photo/bm06/plane&fn=img_7927.jpg
>>
>> The BLM sets very strict usage requirements, they don't even allow fires
>> directly on the ground anymore because it bakes the clay and is too
>> difficult to restore. Most of the art cars are pretty darn efficient, ours
>> was based on an old Volvo station wagon and could transport 20 people.
>> Cargo trucks are more efficient than hauling the same amount of weight in
>> passenger cars.
>>
>> If you want to get technical, air travel is much more environmentally
>> destructive than driving several hundred miles for a week's vacation.
>> People flying to Costa Rica on eco-vacations burn a lot more fuel than
>> people driving to Nevada. It's pointless to argue that one is somehow more
>> worthwhile than the other if you're not the person making the decision to
>> partake.
>>
>>

>>>

>>>>>>>>>> From: Eric Spire <ericspire@yahoo.com>
>>>>>>>>>> To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
>>>>>>>>>> Subject: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy Capitalists
>>>>>>>>>> Date: Thu, 30 Aug 2007 14:07:11 -0700 (PDT)
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> That message was so DEAD ON. The only thing I would
>>>>>>>>>> add is a definition of what the writer does not
>>>>>>>>>> address exactly....
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> It's a phrase I made up when the dead heads lost their
>>>>>>>>>> parking lot and shows and started ruining the rave
>>>>>>>>>> scene.
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> HIPPY CAPITALISM
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> DEFINED AS: Capitalists using hippy idealism for the
>>>>>>>>>> purpose of seperating the idealists from their money
>>>>>>>>>> via a mock-display of those same ideals. The HC
>>>>>>>>>> usually takes on the appearance of the group they are
>>>>>>>>>> extorting. The HC knows the lingo, mind-set, and
>>>>>>>>>> culture of the sub-group they are targetting, and to
>>>>>>>>>> many, appear to be a bullwark of the cause. Many HC's
>>>>>>>>>> have narcicistic tendancies, and fancy the idea that
>>>>>>>>>> they are leader of the group, a revered contributor,
>>>>>>>>>> and in many cases, also think of themselves as
>>>>>>>>>> artistic leaders.
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> Thats it.
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>> E
>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>                     
>>>>>>>>>>> Having read your various comments, a few things
>>>>>>>>>>> should be addressed.
>>>>>>>>>>> First, this operation was extensively planned well
>>>>>>>>>>> in advance, and the
>>>>>>>>>>> number one thing to Black Rock Intelligence was that
>>>>>>>>>>> NO ONE be hurt.
>>>>>>>>>>> If you people actually knew us, you'd know that we
>>>>>>>>>>> have an extensive
>>>>>>>>>>> background in doing things exactly like this. In
>>>>>>>>>>> fact, we were on the
>>>>>>>>>>> ground for some thirty minutes before ascent,
>>>>>>>>>>> scoping the scene and
>>>>>>>>>>> clearing people in order to minimize any possiblity
>>>>>>>>>>> of injury to
>>>>>>>>>>> others. We were aided by several people who were
>>>>>>>>>>> recruited on the
>>>>>>>>>>> playa the night of this burn (BRI has no idea who
>>>>>>>>>>> they are, so don't
>>>>>>>>>>> bother asking).
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>> Second, the operation was planned in conjunction
>>>>>>>>>>> with the lunar
>>>>>>>>>>> eclipse because Black Rock Intelligence knew that
>>>>>>>>>>> another event at the
>>>>>>>>>>> trash fence would draw the bulk of lunatics to it,
>>>>>>>>>>> rather than to the
>>>>>>>>>>> Man. In fact, one of our peripheral operatives aided
>>>>>>>>>>> in getting as
>>>>>>>>>>> many people to the fence event as possible to help
>>>>>>>>>>> BRI achieve its
>>>>>>>>>>> goal of zero injuries.
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>> Third, word went out across the playa days in
>>>>>>>>>>> advance that Black Rock
>>>>>>>>>>> Intelligence was pulling this op. This word
>>>>>>>>>>> continued to go out right
>>>>>>>>>>> up to the moment that our chief operator began the
>>>>>>>>>>> arduous climb up
>>>>>>>>>>> the guide wire. As you can all see from the results,
>>>>>>>>>>> BRI performed
>>>>>>>>>>> flawlessly in this regard.
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>> We could give a fuck less what you all think of us
>>>>>>>>>>> for doing this.
>>>>>>>>>>> Most of you are newbies who have been drawn in by
>>>>>>>>>>> the semi-religious
>>>>>>>>>>> nature of the event, or maybe just the easy drugs
>>>>>>>>>>> and easier sex. You
>>>>>>>>>>> have nothing to offer the event other than your
>>>>>>>>>>> fucking money and
>>>>>>>>>>> obedience. You spend the rest of your lives in
>>>>>>>>>>> mortal fear of
>>>>>>>>>>> everything that insurance companies tell you to
>>>>>>>>>>> fear, and pretend that
>>>>>>>>>>> you're free and clear because you spend four days at
>>>>>>>>>>> a desert
>>>>>>>>>>> bacchanal where spinelessness is not only encouraged
>>>>>>>>>>> but genetically
>>>>>>>>>>> replicated for implementation in successive
>>>>>>>>>>> generations. In short, you
>>>>>>>>>>> are the swine of which Thompson spoke. Get over
>>>>>>>>>>> yourselves.
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>> Some of us live quite well without fear. Doing so
>>>>>>>>>>> requires the
>>>>>>>>>>> ultimate in what Burning Man used to represent:
>>>>>>>>>>> personal
>>>>>>>>>>> responsibility and individual liberty. That's all
>>>>>>>>>>> been lost in the
>>>>>>>>>>> last decade of Burning Man's history. Consider this
>>>>>>>>>>> operation a
>>>>>>>>>>> history lesson that was desperately needed.
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>> One final note: Black Rock Intelligence has been
>>>>>>>>>>> permanently
>>>>>>>>>>> disbanded. All other operatives have made the
>>>>>>>>>>> ultimate sacrifice by
>>>>>>>>>>> swallowing their L-pills to avoid being captured
>>>>>>>>>>> alive. I am the sole
>>>>>>>>>>> surviving member of BRI and ask that you respect my
>>>>>>>>>>> mourning period
>>>>>>>>>>> for those who gave their lives so that this
>>>>>>>>>>> operation was a complete
>>>>>>>>>>> success.
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>> Paul D. Addis
>>>>>>>>>>> Fernley, NV
>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>

Subject: Re: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy Capitalists

Going off the Chron's glowing, aren't those Burners all just so very, 
very, very, splendid and special people, splooge in their pants, fall 
all over themselves over the sheer wunderfullness of The Burn, coverage 
of The Burn, http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/bayarea/burningman/main I'd 
have to go with self-indulgent, spoiled, delusional, affluent, white 
people throwing themselves a party.

Your mileage may vary.

I worked the annual Mike Bloomberg Annual Picnic this year where the 
hedge fund Masters of the Universe blow about $20 mil on a one day 
outdoor party, (this was before the subprime real estate thing hit) and 
The Burn looks just as bad.

Worse actually, since there were plenty of black and other colored 
skinned people besides translucent at Bloomberg, while the vast majority 
of the attendees at The Burn look as white as The Playa. Seriously, it 
looks like a counter-culture Country Club from the 1950s.

Tho' I got to admit, looking at The Faces of Burning Man 
http://tinyurl.com/2no2ed I'd definitely roll the STD dice and try to 
hit as much of that ass as I could.

>> > >>>>>>>>>>>From: Eric Spire <ericspire@yahoo.com>

>> > Capitalists

>> > >>>>>>>>>>>
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>That message was so DEAD ON. The only thing I would
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>add is a definition of what the writer does not
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>address exactly....
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>It's a phrase I made up when the dead heads lost their
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>parking lot and shows and started ruining the rave
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>scene.
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>HIPPY CAPITALISM
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>DEFINED AS: Capitalists using hippy idealism for the
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>purpose of seperating the idealists from their money
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>via a mock-display of those same ideals. The HC
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>usually takes on the appearance of the group they are
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>extorting. The HC knows the lingo, mind-set, and
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>culture of the sub-group they are targetting, and to
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>many, appear to be a bullwark of the cause. Many HC's
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>have narcicistic tendancies, and fancy the idea that
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>they are leader of the group, a revered contributor,
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>and in many cases, also think of themselves as
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>artistic leaders.
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>Thats it.
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>E
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>Having read your various comments, a few things
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>should be addressed.
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>First, this operation was extensively planned well
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>in advance, and the
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>number one thing to Black Rock Intelligence was that
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>NO ONE be hurt.
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>If you people actually knew us, you'd know that we
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>have an extensive
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>background in doing things exactly like this. In
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>fact, we were on the
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>ground for some thirty minutes before ascent,
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>scoping the scene and
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>clearing people in order to minimize any possiblity
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>of injury to
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>others. We were aided by several people who were
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>recruited on the
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>playa the night of this burn (BRI has no idea who
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>they are, so don't
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>bother asking).
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>Second, the operation was planned in conjunction
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>with the lunar
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>eclipse because Black Rock Intelligence knew that
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>another event at the
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>trash fence would draw the bulk of lunatics to it,
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>rather than to the
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>Man. In fact, one of our peripheral operatives aided
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>in getting as
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>many people to the fence event as possible to help
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>BRI achieve its
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>goal of zero injuries.
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>Third, word went out across the playa days in
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>advance that Black Rock
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>Intelligence was pulling this op. This word
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>continued to go out right
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>up to the moment that our chief operator began the
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>arduous climb up
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>the guide wire. As you can all see from the results,
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>BRI performed
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>flawlessly in this regard.
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>We could give a fuck less what you all think of us
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>for doing this.
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>Most of you are newbies who have been drawn in by
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>the semi-religious
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>nature of the event, or maybe just the easy drugs
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>and easier sex. You
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>have nothing to offer the event other than your
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>fucking money and
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>obedience. You spend the rest of your lives in
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>mortal fear of
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>everything that insurance companies tell you to
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>fear, and pretend that
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>you're free and clear because you spend four days at
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>a desert
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>bacchanal where spinelessness is not only encouraged
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>but genetically
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>replicated for implementation in successive
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>generations. In short, you
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>are the swine of which Thompson spoke. Get over
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>yourselves.
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>Some of us live quite well without fear. Doing so
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>requires the
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>ultimate in what Burning Man used to represent:
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>personal
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>responsibility and individual liberty. That's all
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>been lost in the
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>last decade of Burning Man's history. Consider this
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>operation a
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>history lesson that was desperately needed.
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>One final note: Black Rock Intelligence has been
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>permanently
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>disbanded. All other operatives have made the
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>ultimate sacrifice by
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>swallowing their L-pills to avoid being captured
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>alive. I am the sole
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>surviving member of BRI and ask that you respect my
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>mourning period
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>for those who gave their lives so that this
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>operation was a complete
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>success.
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>Paul D. Addis
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>Fernley, NV
>> > >>>>>>>>>>>>

Subject: [sfraves] (nrr) QOD (Fri)

A bit long, but I think pertinent.  It gives me something to think =20
about.  Have a nice Friday.  - DF

--

In the US Navy, a captain who runs his ship aground is relieved of
command, no matter whose fault it turns out to be.  In many countries,
if the national team does poorly in the World Cup soccer
championships, the sports minister must resign.  In other countries,
if a train wreck occurs, the transportation minister is automatically
required to step down.  This is the principle of ministerial
responsibility, the overall political responsibility of the head of an
executive department.

After 9/11, the Bush administration did not observe this principle.
Instead, figures like Ashcroft argued in effect that the greater the
disasters that occurred on their watch, and the more numerous their
failures, the more emergency powers they deserved.  Their maxim was
"the more I fail, the more dictatorial powers I deserve to have."
Ashcroft seemed to think that he was entitled to bungle his way into a
dictatorship.  Such an arrangement provides a positive stimulus for
buearucrats to be less than zealous in preventing the visitation of
disasters upon the citizens.  The principle of ministerial
responsibility provides the most rudimentary and the most essential
reality principle for government officials:  the sure knowledge that
if catastrophes take place on their watch, they will be sacked.  In an
oligarchical system like ours, this is absolutely necessary to create
a minimum common interest between security officials and citizens.
The alien neocon notion of martial law abolishes this reality
principle by threatening to freeze the failed officials in power as a
reward for their own bungling incompetence -- or for their treasonous
complicity.

- Webster Griffin Tarpley, 9/11: Synthetic Terror Made In USA

Think about this, George Tenet's  Medal of Freedom, the blowing off of 
the PDB in August '01, Chertoff ignoring news reports of the levees 
being topped, Condi buying Ferragamos and taking in Spamalot on 
Broadway.....

Now think about the head of the Chinese toy factory killing himself 
after the Mattel lead toy scandal broke
http://www.forbes.com/feeds/ap/2007/08/13/ap4012287.html

Or better yet, the head of their FDA being /executed /by the government 
in the aftermath of the tainted pet food scandal.
http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2007/07/09/AR2007070900689_pf.html

Methinks a different wind is going to blow not soon after the 2008 
Beijing Olympics.

Deepfog wrote:
> A bit long, but I think pertinent.  It gives me something to think 
> about.  Have a nice Friday.  - DF
>
> -- 
>
> In the US Navy, a captain who runs his ship aground is relieved of
> command, no matter whose fault it turns out to be.  In many countries,
> if the national team does poorly in the World Cup soccer
> championships, the sports minister must resign.  In other countries,
> if a train wreck occurs, the transportation minister is automatically
> required to step down.  This is the principle of ministerial
> responsibility, the overall political responsibility of the head of an
> executive department.
>
> After 9/11, the Bush administration did not observe this principle.
> Instead, figures like Ashcroft argued in effect that the greater the
> disasters that occurred on their watch, and the more numerous their
> failures, the more emergency powers they deserved.  Their maxim was
> "the more I fail, the more dictatorial powers I deserve to have."
> Ashcroft seemed to think that he was entitled to bungle his way into a
> dictatorship.  Such an arrangement provides a positive stimulus for
> buearucrats to be less than zealous in preventing the visitation of
> disasters upon the citizens.  The principle of ministerial
> responsibility provides the most rudimentary and the most essential
> reality principle for government officials:  the sure knowledge that
> if catastrophes take place on their watch, they will be sacked.  In an
> oligarchical system like ours, this is absolutely necessary to create
> a minimum common interest between security officials and citizens.
> The alien neocon notion of martial law abolishes this reality
> principle by threatening to freeze the failed officials in power as a
> reward for their own bungling incompetence -- or for their treasonous
> complicity.
>
> - Webster Griffin Tarpley, 9/11: Synthetic Terror Made In USA
>
>

>>>>>>>fires
>>>>>>>directly on the ground anymore because it bakes the clay and is too
>>>>>>>difficult to restore. Most of the art cars are pretty darn efficient, 
>>>>>>>ours
>>>>>>>was based on an old Volvo station wagon and could transport 20 
>>>>>>>people.
>>>>>>>Cargo trucks are more efficient than hauling the same amount of 
>>>>>>>weight in
>>>>>>>passenger cars.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>If you want to get technical, air travel is much more environmentally
>>>>>>>destructive than driving several hundred miles for a week's vacation.
>>>>>>>People flying to Costa Rica on eco-vacations burn a lot more fuel 
>>>>>>>than
>>>>>>>people driving to Nevada. It's pointless to argue that one is somehow 
>>>>>>>more

>>>>>>>decision to
>>>>>>>partake.

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>From: Eric Spire <ericspire@yahoo.com>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Subject: [sfraves] the burned man coverage and Hippy 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Capitalists
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Date: Thu, 30 Aug 2007 14:07:11 -0700 (PDT)
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>That message was so DEAD ON. The only thing I would
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>add is a definition of what the writer does not
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>address exactly....
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>It's a phrase I made up when the dead heads lost their
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>parking lot and shows and started ruining the rave
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>scene.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>HIPPY CAPITALISM
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>DEFINED AS: Capitalists using hippy idealism for the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>purpose of seperating the idealists from their money
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>via a mock-display of those same ideals. The HC
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>usually takes on the appearance of the group they are
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>extorting. The HC knows the lingo, mind-set, and
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>culture of the sub-group they are targetting, and to
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>many, appear to be a bullwark of the cause. Many HC's
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>have narcicistic tendancies, and fancy the idea that
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>they are leader of the group, a revered contributor,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>and in many cases, also think of themselves as
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>artistic leaders.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Thats it.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>E
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Having read your various comments, a few things
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>should be addressed.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>First, this operation was extensively planned well
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>in advance, and the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>number one thing to Black Rock Intelligence was that
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>NO ONE be hurt.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>If you people actually knew us, you'd know that we
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>have an extensive
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>background in doing things exactly like this. In
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>fact, we were on the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>ground for some thirty minutes before ascent,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>scoping the scene and
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>clearing people in order to minimize any possiblity
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>of injury to
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>others. We were aided by several people who were
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>recruited on the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>playa the night of this burn (BRI has no idea who
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>they are, so don't
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>bother asking).
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Second, the operation was planned in conjunction
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>with the lunar
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>eclipse because Black Rock Intelligence knew that
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>another event at the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>trash fence would draw the bulk of lunatics to it,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>rather than to the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Man. In fact, one of our peripheral operatives aided
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>in getting as
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>many people to the fence event as possible to help
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>BRI achieve its
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>goal of zero injuries.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Third, word went out across the playa days in
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>advance that Black Rock
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Intelligence was pulling this op. This word
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>continued to go out right
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>up to the moment that our chief operator began the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>arduous climb up
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>the guide wire. As you can all see from the results,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>BRI performed
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>flawlessly in this regard.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>We could give a fuck less what you all think of us
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>for doing this.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Most of you are newbies who have been drawn in by
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>the semi-religious
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>nature of the event, or maybe just the easy drugs
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>and easier sex. You
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>have nothing to offer the event other than your
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>fucking money and
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>obedience. You spend the rest of your lives in
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>mortal fear of
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>everything that insurance companies tell you to
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>fear, and pretend that
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>you're free and clear because you spend four days at
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>a desert
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>bacchanal where spinelessness is not only encouraged
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>but genetically
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>replicated for implementation in successive
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>generations. In short, you
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>are the swine of which Thompson spoke. Get over
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>yourselves.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Some of us live quite well without fear. Doing so
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>requires the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>ultimate in what Burning Man used to represent:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>personal
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>responsibility and individual liberty. That's all
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>been lost in the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>last decade of Burning Man's history. Consider this
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>operation a
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>history lesson that was desperately needed.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>One final note: Black Rock Intelligence has been
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>permanently
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>disbanded. All other operatives have made the
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>ultimate sacrifice by
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>swallowing their L-pills to avoid being captured
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>alive. I am the sole
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>surviving member of BRI and ask that you respect my
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>mourning period
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>for those who gave their lives so that this
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>operation was a complete
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>success.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Paul D. Addis
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Fernley, NV
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: John Tejada rocks an all-gear LIVE set Saturday @ [KONTROL]

Here we go again!  It's going to be a very special night of music
as the always stellar John Tejada drops a rare all-gear LIVE
perfomance (no records, no laptops!) of that melodic yet pumping
techno that he does oh so well.

The Bay Bridge will be closed this weekend, but BART runs all
night, so no matter where you're at, this will definitely be worth
the trip!  Also, with half the city gone at Burning Man, we can
all enjoy the beautiful weather with a little extra room to dance.

One other VERY EXCITING THING!  The amazing Swiss duo
that performed at our very first [KONTROL] event back in June
of 2005 is back!  After rocking the playa at Burning Man, the
awesome Galoppierende Zuversicht (Bang Goes + Styro2000)
will be stopping by San Francisco for what is sure to be a night
people will be talking about for years.  This one's going down
a week from Saturday at an intimate underground location
that must be seen (and heard!) to be believed.  More on this
one soon, but for now... peep the flyer and start salivating.

http://www.kontrolsf.com/gz/gz_flyer.jpg



Now... on with the show!


Saturday, September 1st, 2007
[KONTROL]

minimal techno + avant-house
every 1st Saturday @ The Endup


featuring from Los Angeles:

JOHN TEJADA : LIVE!

Palette Recordings . Pokerflat . Playhouse
7th City . Plug Research . Immigrant . ~scape

DJ, producer, and Pallete Recordings label owner John Tejada is
without question one of the most respected and prolific techno
producers to ever come out of the U.S..  With dozens of singles,
remixes, and full length albums to his credit, his abundant output is
made only more impressive by the consistently high quality of his
musical creations.

Tejada's worldwide in-demand status lands him in SF quite often to
drop his trademark DJ sets of refined, musical techno.  But it is a
rare treat indeed to get to witness him perform all his own material
live, with all gear and no laptops, as he will this month.  Prepare
for a very special evening with a true icon of modern dance music.


plus special guest:

ELI BINGHAM  ( Gourmet . Nightlight . Movim )


and [KONTROL] residents:

NIKOLA BAYTALA   ( Robsoul . Junior Boys Own . S.W.A.T. )
SAMMY D  ( Classic . Buzzin' Fly . Dirtybird )
CRAIG KUNA   ( Concept SF . ESDJCO )
ALLAND BYALLO   ( Leibe*Detail . Floppy Funk )


________________________________________________

The ENDUP
401 6th St @ Harrison, SF
10pm - 6am / 21+ / $15
http://www.theendup.com

>>> FREE until 11pm! <<<

____________________________________________________


Full bios, pics and FREE music:
http://www.kontrolsf.com

[KONTROL] on MySpace:
http://www.myspace.com/kontrolsf

[ground.KONTROL] on Western Addition Radio:
http://www.westaddradio.com/kontrol/

Flyer front:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K27/K27F.jpg
Flyer back:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K27/K27B.jpg
GIF animation:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K27/K27G.gif
Poster:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K27/K27P.jpg


____________________________________________________


JOHN TEJADA

Normally associated with his peers in Techno from Detroit, Europe and
elsewhere in the US and the world, John Tejada has embraced electronic
music as a personal frontier, expanding on his formidable resume as a
Techno recording artist as producer and remixer, DJ, and label owner.
With dozens of singles, remixes, some film and TV work and
contributions to sample CDs to his credit, this recent expansion has
born a slew of tracks deeply informed by his uncompromised aesthetic
honed over years of diligent production which finds its roots in
Detroit Techno but references a far broader range of music, both in
and outside of electronic music. His musically formative years were
steep in Classical music, growing up in family of performing
artists--his mother a soprano singer and his father a conductor which
then widened to include hip hop, DJing and finally, electronic music.

Known for crafting a brand of subtle, musical techno, his recorded
output ranges across tempo and genre lines, from chilled out affairs
with spacious arrangements to pulsating, densely layered, deeply
energetic tracks that work magnificently in the hands of DJs as well
as on the home stereo. Earlier on, his music found release on labels
such as A13, Multiplex and Generation R&S. Following on to those
successes, he established his own imprint, Palette, in Los Angeles, in
1996, and has enjoyed years of steady growth and recognition. The
label has served as an exclusive outlet for his own prodigious output
but has recently begun to expand its roster. He has also continued to
record for other labels such as Pokerflat, Plug Research, Seventh
City, Playhouse and others, often in collaboration since 1991 with
Arian Leviste, and alongside these numerous singles, has also produced
albums for Playhouse, Palette, Plug Research, deFocus, Moods and
Grooves, Immigrant and A13.

John Tejadas' Website:
http://www.paletterecordings.com/

John Tejada's Discography:
http://www.discogs.com/artist/John%20Tejada

John Tejada Production Sampler:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K27/john_tejada_production_sampler.mp3
includes bits of: Sweat (On The Walls), Mono On Mono, Chorgs, Higher,
and The End Of It All


________________________________________________

ELI BINGHAM

San Francisco local Eli B made his DJing debut at legendary '90s
techno weekly Static, before taking up a residency at Sabotage under
the tutelage of the One Trak Mind crew and residents such as Sutekh
and Kit Clayton.  Eventually promoting a series of his own events
called Sex In Zero Gravity, with guests like John Tejada and Kenny
Larkin, Eli turned to production in 2002.  To date, he has had
releases on such labels as Gourmet, Movim, Slow Motion Sequence, MDEX,
and Nightlight Music, as well as international gigs in London and New
Zealand.  His DJing style blends classic techno and house with an
eclectic selection of modern electronic dance.

Eli Bingham's Discography:
http://www.discogs.com/artist/Eli%20Bingham

Eli on MySpace:
http://www.myspace.com/eli_b

Eli Bingham live on Western Addition Radio:
http://westaddradio.com/albacore/albacore-11-15-06.mp3
http://westaddradio.com/albacore/albacore-10-18-06.mp3


_____________________________________________________

http://www.kontrolsf.com
